text: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Publisher's Introduction. Indeed, all praise is due to Allah, we praise Him, we seek His help and we seek His forgiveness, and we seek refuge in Allah from the evils of our souls and from the evil consequences of our deeds. Whomever Allah guides, no one can misguide him, and whomever He leaves astray, no one can guide him. I bear witness that there is no god but Allah alone, without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His messenger. As for what follows: It is known from the creed of Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah that belief in the Last Day is a pillar of the pillars of Faith, and that the Last Day has minor and major signs preceding it. Among the major signs are: The emergence of the Antichrist (Al-Masih ad-Dajjal), and the descent of Jesus son of Mary (Isa ibn Maryam), peace be upon him. Imam Muslim narrated in his "Sahih" (2901) from Hudhayfah bin Asid Al-Ghifari who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) came out to us while we were discussing. He said: "What are you discussing?" They said: We are mentioning the Hour. He said: "It will not be established until you see ten signs before it." He mentioned: "The Smoke, the Dajjal, the Beast, the rising of the sun from its west, the descent of Jesus son of Mary (peace be upon him), Gog and Magog, and three landslides (Khasf): a landslide in the East, a landslide in the West, and a landslide in the Arabian Peninsula, and the last of that is a fire emerging from Yemen driving people to their place of gathering." Due to the gravity of the matter of the Dajjal and the evil of his tribulation, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There is no prophet except that he warned his nation about the Dajjal, and I warn you about him: He is blind in one eye, and Allah is not blind in one eye. He walks on the earth, and the heavens and earth belong to Allah. Verily, the right eye of the False Messiah (Al-Masih) is like a floating grape." Narrated by Ibn Khuzaymah (p. 32) from Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him). And the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded seeking refuge from the evil of his tribulation in prayer; he said: "When one of you finishes...

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist (Al-Masih ad-Dajjal) and the Descent of Jesus (Isa) peace be upon him
text: ...the last Tashahhud, let him seek refuge in Allah from four things: From the torment of Hell, from the torment of the grave, from the trials of life and death, and from the evil of the False Messiah (Al-Masih ad-Dajjal)." Narrated by Muslim (588) from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him). Due to the importance of this matter, and to clarify that it is from the creed of Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah, our Sheikh, the hadith scholar, the Mark, Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani (may Allah have mercy on him) authored this book: "The Story of the Antichrist (Al-Masih ad-Dajjal), and the Descent of Jesus (peace be upon him), and His Killing of Him; based on the context of the narration of Abu Umamah (may Allah be pleased with him), with additions from what has been authentically reported from other Companions (may Allah be pleased with them)." It is a valuable work from the precious gems of the Sunnah left behind by our Sheikh. What encouraged our Sheikh Al-Albani to write this book - as he mentioned in his introduction - were two matters: First: The doubt of many who are affiliated with knowledge regarding the creed of the descent of Jesus (peace be upon him) and his killing of the Dajjal at the end of time. Second: That people in general - except whom Allah wills - no longer talk about the emergence of the Dajjal and the descent of Jesus (peace be upon him). The heirs of the Sheikh (may Allah have mercy on him) - in cooperation with the Islamic Library in Amman - saw fit to publish this book so that Muslims across the earth may benefit from it, and so the Sheikh may be rewarded for it after his death, seeking help from some students of knowledge. May Allah reward everyone with good. Amman - The Levant, 2 Rabi' al-Thani 1421 AH. The Publisher.

text_en: In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate. Section One: Introduction of the Author — The Reason for Writing the Book. All praise is due to Allah, we praise Him, seek His help, and ask His forgiveness. We seek refuge in Allah from the evils within ourselves and from our bad deeds. Whomever Allah guides, none can mislead; and whomever He leaves astray, none can guide. I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, alone without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. “O you who believe, fear Allah as He should be feared, and do not die except in a state of submission [to Him]” [Āl ‘Imrān: 102]. “O mankind, fear your Lord who created you from a single soul and created from it its mate, and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed, Allah is ever Watchful over you” [al-Nisā’: 1]. “O you who believe, fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice. He will rectify your deeds for you and forgive your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great success” [al-Aḥzāb: 70–71]. To proceed: the most truthful speech is the Book of Allah, and the best guidance is the guidance of Muhammad ﷺ. The worst of matters are newly invented ones, every innovation is misguidance, and every misguidance is in the Fire. As for what follows: it never occurred to my mind that I would one day dedicate time to writing...
text_ar: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم  القسم الأول  مقدمة المؤلف  سبب تأليف الكتاب إن الحمد لله، نحمده ونستعينه ونستغفره، ونعوذ بالله من شرور أنفسنا، وسيئات أعمالنا، من يهده الله فلا مضل له، ومن يضلل فلا هادى له، وأشهد أن لا إلا اله إلا الله وحده لا شريك له، وأشهد أن محمدًا عبده ورسوله. (يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله حق تقاته ولا تموتن إلا وأنتم مسلمون) [آل عمران: 102]، {يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم الذى خلقكم من نفس واحدة وخلق منها زوجها وبث منهما رجالاً كثيرًا ونساءً واتقوا الله الذى تساءلون به والأرحام إن الله كان عليكم رقيبا} [النساء: 1]، (يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وقولوا قولا سديدا. يصلح لكم أعمالكم ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم ومن يطع الله ورسوله فقد فاز فوزا عظيما) [الأحزاب: 70 و71]. أما بعد؛ فإن أصدق الحديث كتاب الله، وأحسن الهدى هدى محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم، وشر الأمور محدثاتها، وكل محدثة بدعة، وكل بدعة ضلالة، وكل ضلالة فى النار. وبعد؛ فإنه لم يكن ليخطر فى بالى أن أتوجه يوما إلى تخصيص وقت ما

text: to write this treatise. However, Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, if He wills a matter, prepares its causes. That is, in the beginning of Jumada al-Ula in the year 1393 AH, my investigation of the book 'Al-Fath Al-Kabir fi Damm Al-Ziyadah ila Al-Jami' Al-Saghir' — and separating it into two books: 'Sahih Al-Jami' Al-Saghir...' and 'Da'if Al-Jami' Al-Saghir...' — led me to the hadith of Abu Umamah Al-Bahili, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding the Prophet's (peace and blessings be upon him) warning to his nation about the Dajjal (Antichrist), and his (peace and blessings be upon him) description of him with descriptions no prophet before him had used, and Jesus's (peace and blessings be upon him) killing of him in (Lod) in Palestine, and other facts related to the Messiah of Guidance [Jesus] and the Messiah of Misguidance [Dajjal]. By virtue of the investigation methodology I adopted in the two aforementioned books, it required studying the chain of transmission of the referenced hadith and examining it. I found it to be weak and impossible to rely upon on its own, especially in such matters of creed and certainty. However, upon my first glance at its text, it became clear to me that much of it is authentic and established in the 'Two Sahihs' [Bukhari and Muslim] and other books of Sunnah. Since it is self-evident that I cannot judge the entire hadith as authentic based merely on such a hasty glance, and consequently include it in the first of the two aforementioned books: 'Sahih Al-Jami'... rather, it is necessary to scrutinize all its paragraphs, indeed its very words, and trace them in the depths of the books of Sunnah and the various hadiths contained therein; those having a close or distant relationship to Jesus (peace and blessings be upon him) and the Greater One-Eyed Dajjal (may Allah curse him), and what relates to them, and to study their chains of transmission with extensive verification similar to the method we followed in our two books: 'The Series of Authentic Hadiths' (Silsilat Al-Ahadith Al-Sahihah) and 'The Series of Weak Hadiths' (Silsilat Al-Ahadith Al-Da'ifah);

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: so that we may ultimately be able to decisively judge the authenticity of all or most of it, and thereafter include it in the 'Sahih', either wholly or mostly, according to what the investigation concludes. Thus, determination was directed towards studying the mentioned hadith paragraph by paragraph, indeed word by word, and mentioning the hadiths that strengthen each paragraph whenever I found a way to do so, and referencing [Takhrij] all of them while discussing their chains of transmission—authenticating or weakening—and tracking the corroborating reports (Mutaba'at) and witnessing reports (Shawahid) for them. This helps us to salvage whatever is possible of its paragraphs from the weakness inherent in them due to the chain itself through which it was narrated from the hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him. It became clear to me after this meticulous study that the hadith, in all its paragraphs—except a few—is 'Authentic due to other evidence' (Sahih li-ghayrihi). In fact, many of them fall under the category of Mutawatir (mass-transmitted), definitely established from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him; such as that which relates to the emergence of the One-Eyed Dajjal, the descent of Jesus peace be upon him from the sky, and his killing of him [Dajjal]. It was quite natural that I would find, in those hadiths I referenced, a great many benefits related to Jesus peace be upon him and the One-Eyed Dajjal—things that were not mentioned in the hadith of Abu Umamah at all; especially since the number of hadiths reached nearly thirty, from more than twenty Companions. Some of them have more than one chain of transmission, particularly the hadith of Abu Hurairah; I extracted ten paths for it alone, and in each path, there are sometimes benefits and additions not found in the other paths.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Therefore, after I finished studying the hadith and its paragraphs, and extracting the witnesses for them from the indicated hadiths, and depositing it in my book 'The Series of Authentic Hadiths' under number (2457), a beautiful idea occurred to me; namely, to track those indicated benefits and append them to their appropriate places in the hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, and present them with it in a single context. This is similar to the method I followed in my book 'The Farewell Pilgrimage of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, as Narrated by Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him'; with a fundamental difference between the two hadiths. [In Jabir's hadith] I tracked and placed every authentic addition in the appropriate place in the context of his hadith, may Allah be pleased with him, from the narration of Muslim via Abu Ja'far Al-Baqir from him. As for the hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, I appended to it what was authenticated from other Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, and their number exceeded twenty Companions, as previously indicated. This idea kept recurring to me, and I turned it over in my mind time and again, until it took hold of me and compelled me to bring it into existence; due to the importance I saw in it, and the necessity of presenting it to the people in this marvelous context that is easy for all people to access—regardless of their different cultures and ranks—and brings closer to them the scattered benefits dispersed in the hadiths which most of the elite scholars cannot extract, let alone the general public.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: The following matters encouraged me to do this: First: The skepticism of many who affiliate themselves with knowledge—indeed, even with the call to Islam, let alone others who have no Islamic culture among the educated youth and the general public—regarding the doctrine of the descent of Jesus, peace and blessings be upon him, and his killing of the Dajjal at the end of time. It has even settled in my mind that many students graduating from Al-Azhar University are among these skeptics—if not among the deniers of it. I realized this from discussing it with some of them verbally, and from looking at the fatwas of some, and the comments of others on certain books. Among the most famous of these scholars is Sheikh (Muhammad Abduh); for he says regarding the hadith of the descent of Jesus peace be upon him: sometimes that it is a solitary (Ahad) hadith! And this is according to his knowledge of Hadith, and he is one of the furthest contemporary scholars from it in my critique. And at other times he interprets his descent and rule on earth as the prevalence of his spirit and the secret of his message over people, which is what dominated his teachings regarding the command for mercy, love, and peace... This was recounted by Sayyid Rashid Rida in his 'Tafsir' (3/217); and although he refuted him by saying immediately after: 'But the apparent meanings of the hadiths narrated regarding that refuse this,' he [Rida] then countered this correction by saying immediately after that: 'But the proponents of this interpretation have the right to say: These hadiths have been transmitted by meaning, like most hadiths, and the transmitter of meaning conveys what he understood.' He (meaning: Muhammad Abduh) was asked about

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: the Antichrist (Dajjal) and Jesus killing him? He said: The Dajjal is a symbol for superstitions, quackery, and evils that will disappear by establishing the Sharia in its proper form...! It is strange that the claimant to prophethood (Mirza Ghulam Ahmad Al-Qadiani Al-Hindi) preceded him in this interpretation, and repeated it in his books and treatises. How similar this interpretation is to his interpretation of many Quranic verses; distorting them and using them as evidence for his prophethood; such as his interpretation of the Almighty's saying regarding Jesus: {And giving good tidings of a Messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad} [As-Saff: 6]; claiming that he is the one intended by His saying: {Ahmad}! He has much of this sort, which is of utmost absurdity; as Sayyid Rashid himself said in the context of refuting him in another place in his 'Tafsir' (6/58), where he said: 'He followed the method of the claimants to Mahdism from the Shi'a of Iran—like the Baha'is and the Babis—in deducing delusional proofs for his call from the Quran; to the extent that he extracted that from Surah Al-Fatiha! And he has a book interpreting it that is the utmost in absurdity, claiming it is a miracle for him!! He made it a glad tiding of his appearance, and that he is the Messiah of this nation!' Sayyid Rashid said following that: 'This strange door of interpreting the Quran and distorting its words from the meanings they were coined for, to strange meanings that do not resemble or suit them, was only opened upon this nation by those heretics from the Magians and their helpers who devised the teachings of the Batini (esoteric) sects; so it gained currency even among many of the Sufis.'

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: I say: Then what is the difference between the interpretation of these Batinis of the Quran; and the interpretation of the Qadianis, (Muhammad Abduh), and those who followed him regarding the hadiths of the Descent and the Dajjal with that obviously false interpretation?! And how did Sayyid Rashid, may Allah have mercy on him, remain silent about it; indeed, he devised a new interpretation for them that the hadiths were transmitted by meaning?! I wish I knew! Does that necessitate rejecting the meanings whose narration from the Companions is valid, let alone what is Mutawatir (mass-transmitted) from them?! For example: If it is Mutawatir from the Companions that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade something like the meat of domestic donkeys; this is definitely narration by meaning. Does this necessitate rejecting this meaning which they narrated regarding the prohibition through some method of interpretation; such that this prohibition is nullified and becomes as if it was never mentioned at all?! By Allah! This is indeed manifest error. We ask Allah Almighty to protect us from it. Here is another example of the interpretation that some contemporary writers from Al-Azhar have been afflicted with: Sheikh (Muhammad Fahim Abu Ubayyah) said in his commentary on 'Nihayat al-Bidaya wa al-Nihaya' (1/71): 'Is Jesus peace be upon him still alive until now? And will he descend to earth to renew the call to Allah's religion himself? Or is the intent of Jesus's descent the victory of the religion of truth and its spread anew at the hands of sincere people working to rid human society of evils and sins? Two opinions (!) each held by a group of scholars (!). And this is what is said regarding the Antichrist (Dajjal): Is he flesh and blood who spreads corruption and threatens the servants, possessing means of enticement, terror, and corruption; until

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Allah destines Jesus peace be upon him for him so he kills him? Or is he a symbol for the spread of evil, the prevalence of sedition, and the weakness of virtuous impulses, upon which the wind of good, symbolized by Jesus peace be upon him, blows, removing it and eliminating it, and taking people by the hand to the path of good and the method of justice and religiosity?'! (1) I say: This 'Fahim' (Understanding One) Azhari is not content with this nullification of the texts of the Sunnah and interpreting them—via the method of symbolism which is the doctrine of the atheist Batinis; as previously recounted from Sayyid Rashid Rida himself—but he misleads the readers into thinking that this nullification is an opinion of some scholars opposing the first opinion! The truth is that no one of repute in knowledge among the People of Hadith and Sunnah has said this. Rather, it was said by some Kharijites and Mu'tazila among the deviant sects. Qadi Iyad said: 'In these hadiths is a proof for Ahl al-Sunnah regarding the reality of the Dajjal's existence, and that he is a specific person through whom Allah tests His servants and empowers him over things; such as reviving the dead person he kills (Paragraph 17 and 18 - Abu Umamah, 18 - Context), the appearance of fertility, rivers, Paradise and Fire, the treasures of the earth following him, his commanding the sky to rain and the earth to sprout vegetation (Paragraphs 19-21 Abu Umamah, 19-21 - Context). All of that is by Allah's will, then He renders him incapable, so he cannot kill the man or anyone else, then He nullifies his affair, and Jesus the son of Mary kills him. Some of the Kharijites, Mu'tazila, and Jahmiyyah opposed this; denying his existence and rejecting the authentic hadiths.'

text: I say: And this is exactly what this 'Fahim' Azhari and some of his teachers have done—following their predecessors from the Kharijites and Mu'tazila; and finally the Qadianis as previously mentioned—sometimes by casting doubt on the authenticity of the hadiths by claiming they are solitary (Ahad)—as Sheikh (Mahmoud Shaltut) did in some of his articles; following Sheikh (Muhammad Abduh) as previously mentioned—and sometimes by way of interpretation and nullification as this 'Fahim' did! And although he limited himself in his previous speech to recounting the two opinions—allegedly—without clearly defining his stance on them; he only did that to deceive and mislead the readers, and to prepare their minds to accept what he would prefer later! Listen to him as he says in his commentary on the following paragraph (12 - Abu Umamah, 14 - Context): 'Every believer, literate or illiterate, will read it': 'Scholars differed regarding the writing here: Is it literal; or is it a metonymy for the signs indicating its owner? And that reading means the believing soul is inspired by its illumination to see the truth without doubt... And perhaps this is closer and safer' (1)! Thus spoke this 'Fahim', ignoring the statement of Imam Al-Nawawi and others contrary to his preference. Al-Hafiz said in 'Al-Fath' (13/85): 'Al-Nawawi said: The correct view held by the verifiers is that the mentioned writing is literal, Allah made it a decisive sign of the Dajjal's falsehood, revealing it to the believer and hiding it from whom He intended misery.' Al-Hafiz said:

text: 'And Iyad narrated a difference of opinion, and that some said: It is a metaphor for the mark of createdness upon him, which is a weak view.' Then that 'Fahim' was not content with preferring that invalid interpretation; rather, he asserts it after several pages; saying (p. 118): 'The difference in what was narrated of hadiths regarding the place of Dajjal's appearance... indicates that the intent of the Dajjal is the symbol of evil and its rise...'! And this is what he asserted in his preface to the book; saying: (p. 9) 'Then we proceeded with those who say that the appearance of the Mahdi and the descent of Jesus peace be upon him are symbols for the victory of good over evil, and that the Dajjal is a symbol for the spread of sedition and the dominance of misguidance for a period of time...'! I say: This 'Fahim' is the head of the Al-Azhar mission in (Lebanon); as printed under his name on the book's cover. He has greatly offended the author on one hand, and the Prophetic Hadith on the other, in his commentary on the mentioned book; which indicates his extreme ignorance of it! For he definitively weakened authentic hadiths; because his heart could not accommodate them! And no one of the people of knowledge preceded him in that—like the hadith of Al-Jassasah; see (p. 6, 69, 101), and Muslim narrated it, and the hadith of the Mahdi (p. 37)—disregarding the authentication of the author Ibn Kathir for some of them (p. 42 and 43); rather, he asserted the fabrication of another hadith narrated by Muslim in his 'Sahih' (p. 58-59)!

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: As for his offense against the book and the author; it is that he placed titles from himself within the body of the book without alerting to that, and some of them are contrary to the method of the author; considering him [the author] one of the Imams of Hadith who believe in the texts related to the signs of the Hour without interpreting them [metaphorically]; as the innovators from the Mu'tazila and others do. And this 'Fahim' has shown in his referenced comments that he followed their path exactly. For here he is, for example, placing a title from himself in the body of the book (p. 116): 'A Hadith that must be diverted from its apparent meaning'! He placed it above the hadith of Muslim regarding the Dajjal killing the believer and reviving him; (see paragraph 17 and 18 - Abu Umamah). And another title he placed on the hadiths narrated about Ibn Sayyad, some of which are in Bukhari! He said (p. 104): 'Rejected narratives; because they are not believed by reason, and it is not reasonable that they were issued by the Messenger, peace be upon him.' As if the Messenger, according to this 'Fahim', should not speak of unseen matters which reason has no choice but to submit to, and thus faith in the Unseen, which is [essence of] belief, has no existence in his soul!! And he placed a title on the hadith of the punishment of image-makers (2/50): 'The punishment of sculptors [makers of 3D images] on the Day of Resurrection'.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: In summary; these titles he placed from himself within the folds of the book; while they contradict scientific integrity; they - at the same time - indicate the extent of this 'Fahim's' knowledge, and the loss incurred by the publishers of the book materially and morally; since his mentioned comments have changed the features of the book, and made it, with these titles and comments, another book that is not the book of Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir! Would that the transgression of this 'Fahim' upon the book stopped at this limit; he exceeded it to deleting many of its texts and hadiths that did not please his great mind! That is what he declared in his preface to the book; saying (p. 5): 'Rather, we were compelled to drop some of the narratives included by the author in his book; because they contained meaning that does not agree with reason nor align with religion'! Indeed, the reader of his comments finds the notification - in many pages of the book - that he dropped from it whatever he wished without mentioning the text of what was deleted; so that the readers would be aware of it; as integrity requires - this is if deletion were permissible! - From that is his saying (2/285): 'We dropped here passages that modesty would be shy of...'! And the strangest thing I saw from him is that he deleted four full pages leaving them blank in the second volume! They are pages (89, 99, 101, and 102)! By Allah, I have seen various types of claimants to knowledge in this time; but I have not seen the likes of this 'Fahim' in audacity, ignorance, and arrogance! Were it not that he is so; then tell me

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: by your Lord, how did he permit for himself this disgraceful behavior, violating scientific integrity in the book of Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir; adding titles from himself, deleting pages, weakening authentic hadiths, or invalidating their meanings in the name of interpretation and reason?! I do not know - by Allah - how the publisher of the book was deceived by him?! He said in his introduction: 'As for the checking and verification; we have been successful - praise be to Allah - in that the eminent Sheikh Muhammad performed a commendable effort which purified the book from... linguistic errors and numerous distortions in the names of prominent figures mentioned in it, and correcting many of the texts contained within it'! It is strange - by Allah - that this 'Fahim' is described with these attributes, while the book has hundreds of evidences indicating that he is exactly the opposite! For he corrupted many of its texts, and fell into uncountable linguistic errors and numerous distortions within a single page! A matter which indicates that the Saudi lands think too well of the likes of this Azhari; which reminds me of the proverb: 'The small birds become eagles in our land'! Here are some examples I found in the first volume of the book: 1 - p (114): 'And (Jummah - hair) is removed' - written with Jeem and Kasra! - 'of every possessor of (Jummah)'. The correct is: 'Hummah' - with an un-dotted Ha and light Meem -: Poison! He repeated this error in page (169), and commented on it with what confirms it is a scientific error; saying:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 'Al-Jummah: Hair gathered at the front of the head. Perhaps the meaning of removing (the Jummah of every possessor of Jummah) is: ridding society of different hairstyles that bind desiring eyes and lustful souls to girls... And it is self-evident that the word (possessor of Jummah) in the noble Hadith is functioning as an adjective for a deleted noun...' to the end of his nonsense! 2 - Three lines after the mentioned page (114): 'And the earth will be like the (Aathur) of silver'. The poor man commented on it saying: 'Al-Aathur: A perilous land...'. Whereas it is 'Ka-Fathur' with a Fa and Tha, which is: A tray. Or it is said: A basin or bowl of gold or silver. 3 - And on the following page (115): 'And Abu Dawood (Jarada - stripped) his chain'! The correct is: 'Jawwada' (made good/strong). 4 - And on p (117): 'Muhammad bin Abdullah bin (Qahran)'! It is actually (Qahzad). 5 - On the same page: 'Fa-yushajj (he is wounded in head). He says: Take him and (Shajjuhu - wound him)'!! And he commented on it: 'Al-Shajj: A wound in the face and head'!

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: The correct is: 'Fa-yushabbah... wa shabbihuhu' with a dotted Shin, then a doubled Ba, then an un-dotted Ha; meaning: stretch him out on his stomach; as Al-Nawawi said. 6 - p (133): 'With the (Maradah - rebels)'! It is actually 'Al-Qiradah' (monkeys). 7 - p (142): 'Musa bin Ubaydah (Al-Yazidi)'. The correct is: 'Al-Rabadhi'. 8 - p (144): 'The Dajjal will descend in (Hawran)'! The correct is: 'Khuz'; as in 'Al-Musnad' (2/319 and 337). 9 - p (146): 'Whoever hears (from - min) the Dajjal (Falasna minhu - we are not from him)'! This error occurred twice on the mentioned page, and he repeated it again (p. 154); which confirms it is an error from him, not the printer, and that's why he didn't correct it in the errata. The correct hadith is: 'Man sami'a bi-Dajjal fal-yan'a 'anhu'; meaning let him move away from him. It seems (The Fahim) could not read 'Fal-yan'a' correctly; so he distorted it to (Falasna), and consequently distorted 'bi-Dajjal' (of the Dajjal) to 'min Dajjal' (from the Dajjal), and ''anhu' (away from him) to 'minhu' (from him). 10 - Same page: 'And Abu Al-Dahma, and his name is (Firqah bin Bahir Al-Dawi)'! The correct is: 'Qirfah - with Kasra on Qaf and Sukun on Ra followed by Fa - Ibn Buhays - with Ba and un-dotted Ha, diminutive - Al-Adawi'!

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 11 - p (154) 'Hisham from Dastawa'i'! The correct is: 'Hisham Al-Dastawa'i'. 12 - p (180): 'Abi Ishaq'! The correct is 'Ibn Ishaq'. 13 - p (202): 'Migration does not benefit as long as the enemy fights'. The correct is: 'Migration does not cease...'. So reflect! How he inverted the meaning of the hadith and corrupted it with his extreme ignorance and arrogance?! 14 - p (214): '... Ibn Qawtb' And this has no existence among narrators. It is actually: 'Ibn Quwayd'; as in 'Al-Musnad' (2/442) and others. 15 - Among the strangest distortions I saw from him is that he brought a hadith that does not exist - not even in the fabricated collections - due to a subject getting distorted for him. In (2/58): 'In the Hadith: (Adimu - Make condiment) your food with His remembrance and prayer, and do not (Taqumuhu - sweep it) lest your hearts harden' And he commented on it saying: 'Qamm al-Khuwan: eating what is on the table leaving nothing, and Adama his bread: mixed it with what makes it palatable. The Messenger, peace be upon him, advises his followers that the remembrance of Allah Almighty should be the condiment of their food...' to the end of his eloquent speech!

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: The Hadith is actually with the wording: '(Adhibu - Melt/Dissolve) your food with the remembrance of Allah and prayer, and do not sleep upon it lest your hearts harden.' So 'Adhibu' was distorted for him to 'Adimu'! And his saying 'Do not sleep upon it' to 'La Taqumuhu' (Do not sweep it), then he built upon it what he built of delicate meaning!! Thus it was narrated by a group of Hadith scholars, and Al-Suyuti cited it in 'Al-Jami Al-Saghir'. Had he referred to it - as beginner students do, let alone a 'Head of Mission' - he would have known the origin of the hadith and not fallen into such hideous distortion! Furthermore, the hadith with this narrated wording is fabricated; as I verified in 'Al-Ahadith Al-Mawdu'ah' (115). So reflect on the extent of this (Fahim's) verification! Instead of noticing the correct wording of the hadith and noting its fabrication, he brought a hadith with no basis, then commented on it!!! In summary: The man's verification of this book - and his commenting on it with such comments - is the greatest proof that he is not qualified to verify a small treatise by a virtuous scholar of the Salaf! How then could he be qualified to verify a huge volume of the book of Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir, may Allah have mercy on him?! And to authenticate weak hadiths, and weaken authentic ones arbitrarily without adhering to the rules of critics and knowledge of disparagement and endorsement, and to interpret them contrary to the people of knowledge?! This is ignorance to a degree that crosses no one's mind! And what would a rational person say about a man who does not understand the meaning of the Prophet's saying regarding those who enter Paradise without account:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 'La Yastariqun' (They do not ask for Ruqyah), saying in his comment on it (2/66): 'Meaning: They do not spy with their ears on people... and this action is called Istiraq al-Sam' (eavesdropping)'?! The poor (Fahim) did not know that this verb is from 'Ruqyah', and the 'Sin' in it is for request, not from 'Sariqah' (theft) where the 'Sin' is a root letter! We return to our main topic; so we say: These interpretations adopted by these later scholars were among the strongest reasons that encouraged me to present the hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, with the additions of others from the Companions in one context. So that it becomes clear to everyone with two eyes the invalidity of those interpretations and their contradiction to the explicit authentic hadiths, and that the interpretation of those interpreters is intended only to get rid of these hadiths, and of believing in them, in a twisted way that deludes the common people that their proponents believe in them, while the reality is they disbelieve in their truths, and only believe in their wordings! By Allah; believing in texts entirely by way of symbol and interpretation is a faith not worth a penny, and avails nothing before Allah. I wish I knew! What is the difference between these scholars affiliated with the Sunnah, who nullify these Mutawatir (mass-transmitted) texts about the emergence of Dajjal, the descent of Jesus peace be upon him, and his killing of him; and the Batinis and deviant sects who believe in the texts of the Book and Sunnah;

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: while interpreting them with interpretations that ultimately lead to disbelief in their truths; like those who deny the Mutawatir texts in the Book and Sunnah regarding the believers seeing their Lord in the Hereafter; interpreting that the intended meaning is seeing the bliss of their Lord! And like the Qadianis who believe - they claimed - in His saying: {But he is the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets} [Al-Ahzab: 40], then they say prophethood continues and many prophets come after him, peace and blessings be upon him; among them (Mirza Ghulam Ahmad Qadiani)! And if you ask them about this verse, they answer you that they believe in it - of course! - but its meaning is not as Muslims understood it before! Rather, the meaning is: But the Seal of the Prophets; meaning: their ornament; like the ring is the ornament of the finger! Does their belief in it avail them anything before Allah after they interpreted it with other than its true interpretation?! Likewise, I say: The belief of these scholars in the Mutawatir hadiths regarding the descent of Jesus peace be upon him and his killing of the Dajjal; avails them nothing with their interpreting them with that symbolic interpretation; because it is contrary to what every scholar stripped of desire cuts decisively when seeing the texts reported regarding them. And perhaps for that reason, some of them resort to getting rid of them by another method - other than the method of interpreting them symbolically - which is the method of casting doubt on their certainty of establishment by claiming they are solitary (Ahad) hadiths! Among these is Sheikh (Mahmoud Shaltut); I had read an answer of his long ago regarding the life of Jesus peace be upon him in the sky and his descent at the end of time - published by 'Al-Risalah' magazine back then - in which I saw immense wonder of ignorance regarding the reality of the hadiths reported about his descent. Among that was his claim that all their paths revolve around Wahb

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: ibn Munabbih and Ka'b al-Ahbar. I denounced that within myself; because my mind was free of such a claim, but I said to myself: Perhaps that is regarding some paths, but the Sheikh exaggerates! To verify that; I rushed to track the hadiths of his descent peace be upon him from their original sources in the books of Sunnah - which narrate hadiths with their chains; like the Six Mothers and others - until I gathered many hadiths regarding that; from Mutawatir paths from more than forty Companions. I was astonished when I did not see a mention of Wahb and Ka'b in any of those paths at all, even those with weak chains! I became certain then that the Sheikh - may Allah forgive him - wrote from his memory; without checking a single book from the referenced books of Sunnah regarding that! So I wrote a detailed treatise refuting his fatwa that day, and intended to send it to 'Al-Risalah' magazine. But one of our friends from the virtuous literati who frequent Egypt advised me not to send it, because they would not publish it; firstly due to its length; and because Sheikh Shaltut is above the level of criticism there; especially from a non-Egyptian person unknown to them! He said: If you must, then shorten the treatise as much as you can, then send it to them, perhaps they will publish it in the magazine, though I don't think they will. And so it was, I shortened it to a page and a half, then sent it, but it was not published!! Responding to the proponents of this method in detail has another place than this. It suffices regarding that the agreement of the scholars of Hadith and its memorizers on the Tawatur (mass transmission) of the hadith of Dajjal and the descent of

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Jesus peace be upon him from the sky; such as Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir (1) and Ibn Hajar and others; indeed Imam Al-Shawkani authored a treatise he named: 'Al-Tawdih fi Tawatur ma ja'a fi Al-Muntazar wa Al-Mahdi wa Al-Masih' (Clarification regarding the mass transmission of what came regarding the Awaited One, the Mahdi, and the Messiah). I have become certain - personally - of the Tawatur of the hadiths of Dajjal and Jesus when I wrote the treatise referred to previously. The paths that gathered with me - back then - reached more than forty paths from about forty Companions, some meeting the conditions of authenticity (Sahih), and the rest mostly having considered corroboration. Regrettably, I do not know where it is now due to moving from one house to another?! Then my certainty of that was renewed during my study of the hadith of Abu Umamah referred to in this introduction. Here are the names of the Companions who narrated the hadiths of Dajjal - whose hadiths I extracted in this study; noting that it did not exhaust everything reported on that due to irrelevance to the mentioned study -: 1 - Hisham bin Amir. 2 - Abdullah bin Mughaffal. 3 - Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman. 4 - Jabir bin Abdullah.

text: 5 - Abdullah bin Umar. 6 - Anas bin Malik. 7 - Abu Hurairah. 8 - Al-Nawas bin Sam'an. 9 - Nufayr bin Malik. 10 - Aisha. 11 - Umm Salama. 12 - Some Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. 13 - Ubadah bin Al-Samit. 14 - Abdullah bin Abbas. 15 - Abu Bakra Al-Thaqafi. 16 - A man from the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. 17 - Safinah, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. 18 - Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri. 19 - Fatimah bint Qais. 20 - Umm Sharik.

text: 4 - Nufayr bin Malik. 5 - Aisha. 6 - Jabir bin Abdullah. 7 - Abu Hurairah. 8 - Hudhayfah bin Asid. 9 - Abdullah bin Amr. And these are the names of other Companions from whom hadiths of the descent of Jesus peace be upon him were narrated with chains acceptable as corroboration: 10 - Abu Umamah Al-Bahili. 11 - Some Companions of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him. 12 - Samurah. 13 - Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman. 14 - Mujammi' bin Jariyah Al-Ansari. This quick display of the paths of the Dajjal hadith, and the hadith of Jesus peace and blessings be upon him, and their narrators from the noble truthful Companions; makes it clear to anyone with two eyes that the Hadith is Mutawatir (mass-transmitted) regarding that, and that anyone who doubts that is among the skeptics in the religion entirely, or is - at least - exposed to that most severely; because whatever was

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Mutawatir - like the Quran and some Hadiths - is exposed with him to denial by way of interpretation; indeed nullification. And whatever of it did not reach the level of Tawatur; is exposed with him to rejection by way of doubting the certainty of its attribution to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. From here it appears that all believers in the Islamic religion; they are in danger regarding their faith if they do not rely on the methodology of the People of Hadith (Ahl al-Hadith) in their receiving of the religion; for they are the most knowledgeable of people regarding what is established of it, and what is not of it in narration, and the most knowledgeable of people regarding its meanings and intents; because they received all that from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, through the correct scientific methods without which there is no way to know the religion, and without which religion becomes followed desire. This is the chronic disease that has afflicted the Islamic world today, and no one is saved from it except the Victorious Group (At-Ta'ifah Al-Mansurah) which the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, gave glad tidings of in many Mutawatir hadiths; among them his saying peace and blessings be upon him: 'A group of my Ummah will continue fighting upon the truth, victorious over those who oppose them; until the last of them fights the Antichrist (Dajjal)' (1). I say: Perhaps what we mentioned of the way of the skeptics is the reason for Umar's strictness against those who deny the Dajjal - and other things established in the authentic Sunnah - for Yusuf bin Mahran narrated from Ibn Abbas who said: I heard Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, on the pulpit saying:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 'There will be among you people from this nation who deny stoning, deny the Dajjal, deny the rising of the sun from its west, deny the punishment of the grave, deny intercession, and deny a people coming out of the Fire after they have been scorched. If I catch them, I will surely kill them the killing of 'Ad and Thamud.' Extracted by Al-Dani in 'Al-Fitan' (Folio 23/2), and Ahmad (1/23) briefly, and its chain is Hasan. The Second Matter - which encouraged me to write this treatise -: That people in general - commoners and elite; except whom Allah wills - no longer talk about the emergence of Dajjal and the descent of Jesus, peace and blessings be upon them; confirming what is in 'Zawa'id Musnad Ahmad' (4/72) from Rashid bin Sa'd who said: When Istakhr was conquered, a caller called out: 'The Dajjal has emerged.' He said: So Sa'b bin Jaththamah met them. He said: He said: Were it not for what you say, I would have informed you that I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'The Dajjal will not emerge until people become oblivious to mentioning him, and until the Imams abandon mentioning him on the pulpits' (1).

And he attributed it in another place (7/351) to Ahmad himself, which is a mistake!

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: This report has indeed come true regarding the Imams of the mosques, for they abandoned mentioning the Dajjal on the pulpits while they are the elite of the people; so what would be the condition of their commoners?! And if Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, has made a cause for everything by His wisdom; I do not doubt that the cause of this neglect of mentioning him - despite the Prophet's (peace and blessings be upon him) extreme concern in warning against his trial; as you will see in the beginning of his story - is but the skepticism of some of the elite regarding the hadiths reported about him; sometimes in their establishment and lack of arrival via Tawatur - they claimed - and sometimes in their indication as previously explained. Thus, it was obligatory for the people of knowledge to perform their duty; to clarify to the nation what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, told them about the trial of the Dajjal and Jesus peace and blessings be upon him killing him; by the same method through which the nation receives from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, everything related to its religion - from beliefs, worships, transactions, ethics, and others, which is the Prophetic Hadith - thereby eliminating the indicated cause, and people return to mentioning the Dajjal and his trial, taking measures to avoid it, so they are not deceived by his misguidance and distortions, the possibility of which occurring from someone like him is only believed by the believer - who does not doubt in the slightest regarding what came of various trials, {And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him} [Al-Qasas: 68]. So if the believer knows that and believes in it; he takes the measures that protect him from his trial; which are:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: First: Seeking refuge in Allah Almighty from the evil of his trial, and doing so frequently; especially in the last Tashahhud in prayer. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'When one of you finishes the last Tashahhud; let him seek refuge in Allah from four, saying: O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell, from the punishment of the grave, from the trial of life and death, and from the evil of the trial of the Messiah Dajjal' (1). It is established in the 'Two Sahihs' and others from a group of Companions - among them Aisha may Allah be pleased with her: that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to seek refuge from his trial. Indeed, he ordered seeking refuge from it as a general command; as in the hadith of Zaid bin Thabit who said: While the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was in a garden of Banu An-Najjar on a mule of his - and we were with him - it shied with him and almost threw him off. Suddenly there were six or five or four graves. He said 'Who knows the occupants of these graves?' A man said: I do. He said: 'When did these die?' He said: They died in Polytheism (and in a narration: in Jahiliyyah). He said: 'Indeed this nation is tested in its graves. Were it not that you would not bury [your dead], I would have invoked Allah to make you hear the punishment of the grave which I hear.' Then he turned his face towards us and said:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 'Seek refuge in Allah from the punishment of the Fire.' They said: We seek refuge in Allah from the punishment of the Fire. He said: 'Seek refuge in Allah from the punishment of the grave.' They said: We seek refuge in Allah from the punishment of the grave. He said: 'Seek refuge in Allah from trials, what is apparent of them and what is hidden.' They said: We seek refuge in Allah from trials, what is apparent of them and what is hidden. He said: 'Seek refuge in Allah from the trial of the Dajjal.' They said: We seek refuge in Allah from the trial of the Dajjal. (1). Second: To memorize ten verses from the beginning of Surah (Al-Kahf). For he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Whoever memorizes ten verses from the beginning of Surah (Al-Kahf); will be protected from the [trial of] Dajjal.' Narrated by Muslim and others from Abu Darda (2). Third: To stay away from him, and not expose oneself to him; unless he knows of himself that he will not harm him due to his trust in his Lord, and his knowledge of his signs which the Prophet - peace and blessings be upon him - described him with; due to his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: 'Whoever hears of the Dajjal, let him go far from him. For by Allah; a man will come to him reckoning that he is a believer, then he will follow him: due to what he sends of doubts.' Extracted by Ahmad and others, from Imran bin Husain (3).

text: Fourth: To reside in Mecca and Medina, for they are two sanctuaries safe from him; due to his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: 'The Dajjal comes and treads the earth except Mecca and Medina. He comes to Medina; and finds at every pass of its passes rows of angels.' Extracted by the Two Sheikhs and others from Anas bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him (1). Like them are Al-Aqsa Mosque and Al-Tur (Mount Sinai); as comes in Paragraph (24 - Context). Know that Allah only made these holy lands a protection from Dajjal for the one who inhabits them while being a believer adhering to the rights and duties owed to their Lord. Otherwise, mere residence - while being far in his life from adopting the manners of a believer therein - is not what makes him protected from him. For it will come in Paragraph (25 - Abu Umamah, 30 - Context) that the Dajjal - upon him be Allah's curses - when he comes to the Prophetic City and the angels prevent him from entering it; it will shake with its people three times, and no hypocrite man or woman will remain therein except they go out to him. These hypocrite men and women - and their hypocrisy might be practical - their residence in the Prophetic City did not protect them from the Dajjal; rather they went out to him, and became of his followers like the Jews! Conversely; those who are in it among the sincere believers in their faith; although they are protected from his trial; some of them may go out to him challenging

book_title_en: The Story of the False Messiah (al-Masīḥ al-Dajjāl) and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
book_title_ar: قصة المسيح الدجال ونزول عيسى عليه الصلاة والسلام
text_en: And it will be proclaimed to his face: “This is the Dajjāl about whom the Messenger of Allah ﷺ used to tell us…” as will come later in paragraph (31 – the context). Therefore, the true criterion is faith and righteous action; that is the greatest cause of salvation. As for living in the land of Hijrah or elsewhere, that is only a secondary cause. Whoever does not take hold of the greater cause will not benefit from clinging to the lesser cause. The Prophet ﷺ indicated this when the man asked him about migration. He said: “Woe to you! Indeed, the matter of Hijrah is severe! Do you have camels?” He replied, “Yes.” He said, “Do you give their charity?” He replied, “Yes.” The Prophet ﷺ said: “Then work from beyond the seas, for Allah will not neglect anything of your deeds.” — How excellent is what Imām Mālik narrated in al-Muwaṭṭa’ (2/235) from Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd: that Abū al-Dardā’ wrote to Salmān al-Fārisī saying: “Come to the Sacred Land (meaning al-Shām).” But Salmān wrote back: “The land does not sanctify anyone; it is only a person’s deeds that sanctify him.” And Allah, the Exalted, speaks the truth when He says: “And say, ‘Do [as you will], for Allah will see your deeds, and His Messenger, and the believers. And you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do.’” [al-Tawbah: 105].

text: For this reason; it is not permissible for Muslims today to abandon working for Islam and establishing its state on earth; waiting for the emergence of the Mahdi and the descent of Jesus, peace and blessings be upon them; out of despair on their part; or imagining that this is not possible before them. For this is a false imagination, and a vain despair. Allah Almighty or His Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, did not inform us that there is no return for Islam nor authority for it on earth except in their time. So it is possible for this to be realized before them if Muslims take the necessary means for it; due to His saying, the Exalted: {If you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet} [Muhammad: 7], and His saying: {And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might} [Al-Hajj: 40]. This misconception was one of the strongest reasons that prompted some guiding professors and contemporary writers to deny the hadiths of the Mahdi and Jesus, peace and blessings be upon them - despite their abundance and mass transmission (Tawatur) - when they saw that for those who held this misconception, they were a cause for relying on them and abandoning work for the glory of Islam for their sake! They erred in this a severe error from two aspects: First: They confirmed them in this misconception; considering that its source was those referenced hadiths; otherwise they would not have hastened to deny them! Second: They did not know how they should address the mentioned misconception? Which is by affirming the hadiths, and invalidating the erroneous concepts surrounding them. Their likeness in this is but like the one who denied the doctrine of belief in Decree (Qadar), its good and its evil; because some believers in it understood from it that its necessary implication is compulsion (Jabr), and that the accountable person has no acquisition nor choice. Since this understanding was obviously false, they hastened to deny it, but they denied the Decree itself with it;

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: due to their imagining - also with those who imagined - that it means compulsion. So they agreed with them in their error regarding the mentioned misconception, then added another error to it - fleeing from the first - which is denying the Decree itself! Had they not shared with them in understanding compulsion from it, they would not have denied it! This is exactly what those referenced professors and writers did; when they saw the reliance of Muslims - except a few of them - on the hadiths of the Mahdi and Jesus; they hastened to deny them to save them, they claimed, from the mentioned reliance! They achieved nothing; because they could not save them by that on one hand; nor were they guided in their denial of authentic hadiths on the other. The truth is that these deniers - who understand from these hadiths what they do not indicate of the alleged reliance, and therefore hasten to deny them to get rid of it - have combined two calamities: misguidance in understanding, and disbelief in the text! But they knew that the mentioned understanding is misguidance in itself, so they denied it by denying the text from which they understood that! The common people did the opposite; they believed in the text along with the mentioned understanding. So with each of the two groups is guidance and misguidance. The truth is taking the guidance of each, and discarding the misguidance they have; which is by believing in the text without that erroneous understanding. The likeness of these and those is but like the Mu'tazila on one hand; and the Anthropomorphists (Mushabbihah) on the other. For the former interpreted the verses and hadiths of Attributes with false interpretations that led them to denying the Divine Attributes. Nothing drove them to that except their fleeing from the anthropomorphism (Tashbih) into which the Anthropomorphists fell. Indeed, the Mu'tazila themselves shared with the Anthropomorphists in understanding anthropomorphism

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: from the verses of Attributes, but they differed from them by denying anthropomorphism through the method of interpretation which is also false; like anthropomorphism because it necessitates denying the Divine Attributes. As for the Anthropomorphists, they did not fall into this falsehood, but they persisted on anthropomorphism. The truth is combining the correctness of these and those, and rejecting the falsehood of these and those: That is by affirmation and transcendence (Tanzih), as Allah the Exalted said: {There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing} [Al-Shura: 11]. Likewise, I say regarding the hadiths of the descent of Jesus peace be upon him and others; the obligation regarding them is believing in them, and rejecting what the misconceivers imagined from them; of abandoning work and preparation which must be performed in every time and place. By that we would have combined the correctness of these and those, and rejected the falsehood of these and those. And Allah is the One sought for help.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: The Hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, with its referencing: (1 - O People! There has never been a tribulation on the face of the earth since Allah created the progeny of Adam greater than the tribulation of the Dajjal. 2 - And indeed, Allah, Mighty and Majestic, has not sent a prophet except that he warned his nation of the Dajjal. 3 - And I am the last of the Prophets, and you are the last of the nations. 4 - And he is emerging among you inevitably. 5 - If he emerges while I am among you, then I am the advocate for every Muslim; and if he emerges after me, then every person is his own advocate, and Allah is my successor over every Muslim. 6 - And he emerges from a road between Sham (Syria) and Iraq. He spreads corruption to the right and left. O servants of Allah, stand firm. 7 - I will describe him to you with a description that no prophet before me has described him with: 8 - He starts by saying: 'I am a prophet,' but there is no prophet after me. 9 - Then he praises again and says: 'I am your Lord.' But you will not see your Lord until you die. 10 - And he is one-eyed, and your Lord is not one-eyed. 11 - And written between his eyes is: Kafir (Disbeliever). 12 - Every believer, literate or illiterate, will read it.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 13 - And part of his trial is that he has with him a paradise and a fire. His fire is paradise and his paradise is fire. 14 - So whoever is tested with his fire, let him seek help from Allah and read the opening verses of (Al-Kahf). 15 - So it will become cool and safe for him as the fire was for Abraham. 16 - And part of his trial is that he says to a Bedouin: 'Do you see, if I resurrected your father and mother for you, would you testify that I am your Lord?' He says: 'Yes.' So two devils impersonate his father and mother for him and say: 'O my son, follow him for he is your Lord.' 17 - And part of his trial is that he overpowers a single soul and kills him. 18 - And saws him with a saw until he is thrown as two halves. Then he says: 'Look at this servant of mine, for I will resurrect him now, then he will claim he has a Lord other than me.' So Allah resurrects him, and the malicious one says to him: 'Who is your Lord?' He says: 'My Lord is Allah, and you are the enemy of Allah, you are the Dajjal. By Allah, I was never more insightful about you than I am today.' 19 - And part of his trial is that he commands the sky to rain and it rains, and commands the earth to grow vegetation. 20 - And part of his trial is that he passes by a clan but they reject him, so no livestock remains for them except that it perishes. 21 - And part of his trial is that he passes by a clan and they believe him. So he commands the sky to rain and it rains, and the earth to grow vegetation and it grows, until their cattle return from that day of theirs fatter than they ever were, their flanks wider and their udders fuller.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 22 - And there remains nothing of the earth but he treads upon it and prevails over it except Mecca and Medina. 23 - He does not come to them from any of their passes except that angels meet him with unsheathed swords. 24 - Until he camps at the red hillock at the end of the marsh. 25 - Then Medina shakes with its inhabitants three times, and no hypocrite man or woman remains except they go out to him. 26 - It expels the impurity from it just as the bellows expels the impurity of iron. 27 - That day is called the Day of Deliverance. 28 - Umm Sharik bint Abi Al-Akar said: 'O Messenger of Allah, where are the Arabs on that day?' He said: 'They are few on that day.' 29 - And most of them are in Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem). 30 - Their Imam is a righteous man. 31 - While their Imam has stepped forward to lead them in the Morning Prayer, Jesus the son of Mary descends upon them at dawn. That Imam retreats, walking backwards, so that Jesus may come forward. Jesus places his hand between his shoulders and says to him: 'Go forward and pray, for it was established for you.' So their Imam leads them in prayer.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 32 - When he finishes, Jesus says: 'Open the door.' It is opened, and behind it is the Dajjal. 33 - With him are seventy thousand Jews, all of them with adorned swords and sashes. 34 - When the Dajjal sees him, he dissolves just as salt dissolves in water. 35 - He runs away fleeing, and Jesus peace be upon him says: 'I have a blow for you that you will not escape.' 36 - He catches him at the Eastern Gate of Ludd and kills him. 37 - Allah defeats the Jews. So nothing of what Allah created remains for a Jew to hide behind except that Allah makes that thing speak - neither stone, nor tree, nor wall, nor animal - except the Gharqad tree, for it is from their trees and does not speak - except it says: 'O Muslim servant of Allah, this is a Jew, come and kill him.' 38 - His days are forty years. 39 - A year like half a year, a year like a month, and a month like a week. 40 - And the last of his days is like a spark. 41 - One of you will be at the gate of Medina and will not reach its other gate until evening comes. 42 - It was said to him: 'How do we pray in those short days?' He said: 'Estimate prayer in them as you estimate it in these long days, then pray.'

text: 43 - Jesus the son of Mary, peace be upon him, will be in my Ummah as a just judge and a fair Imam. He will break the cross, kill the swine, abolish the Jizyah, and leave charity (Sadaqah), so no one will strive [to collect Zakat] on sheep or camel. Hatred and mutual animosity will be lifted. The venom of every venomous creature will be removed until a child puts his hand in a snake's mouth and it does not harm him. 44 - A young girl chases a lion and it does not harm her. War lays down its burdens, and Quraysh is stripped of its kingdom. The earth will be like a silver platter, growing its vegetation as in the time of Adam, until a group of people gather around a bunch of grapes and it satisfies them, and a group gathers around a pomegranate and it satisfies them. The bull will be for such and such amount of money, and the horse for a few dirhams. 46 - They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, why will the horse become cheap?' He said: 'It will never be ridden for war.' 47 - It was said: 'Why will the bull become expensive?' He said: 'The whole earth will be tilled.' 48 - Before the emergence of the Dajjal, there are three severe years in which people suffer severe hunger. Allah commands the sky in the first year to withhold one-third of its rain, and commands the earth to withhold one-third of its vegetation. text: Referencing (Takhrij) of the Hadith: It was narrated with this completeness by Ibn Majah (2/512-516) and Al-Ruyani in summary (Folio 30/8/0 and 10/1) via Ismail bin Rafi' from Abu Zur'ah Al-Saybani Yahya ibn Abi Amr [from Amr bin Abdullah Al-Hadrami] from Abu Umamah Al-Bahili who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, addressed us, and most of his speech was a hadith he told us about the Dajjal and warning us of him. Part of his speech was that he said: ... then he mentioned it at length. I say: This is a weak chain. Amr bin Abdullah Al-Hadrami was not narrated from except by Al-Saybani, and no one declared him trustworthy except Ibn Hibban (1/185), and for that reason Al-Hafiz said: (Maqbul - Acceptable [if supported]). And Ismail bin Rafi' is weak in memory. However, he was followed up by Damrah bin Rabi'ah: Al-Saybani told us with it, except for his saying: (They said: O Messenger of Allah, why will the horse become cheap...) to the end of the hadith. It was narrated by Hanbal bin Ishaq Al-Shaybani - the cousin of Imam Ahmad - in (Al-Fitan) (Folio 52/1 - 53/2) and its completion in (Al-Fawa'id) (3/37/1 - 38/1), and Al-Ajurri in (Al-Shari'ah) (p. 375) - but he did not cite its wording, rather he referred by it to the hadith of An-Nawas coming later - and Ibn Abi Asim in (Al-Sunnah) (Number 391 - my verification), and Abdullah bin Ahmad in (Al-Sunnah) (p. 138-13), and Abu Dawood (2/213).

To facilitate clarifying that for the reader and referencing it myself, I made it into paragraphs with sequential numbers, so I say: 1 - This paragraph came in hadiths: First: From Hisham bin Amir attributed to the Prophet (Marfu') with the wording: (Between the creation of Adam and the establishment of the Hour, there is no creation greater than the Dajjal (and in a narration: no trial greater than the trial of the Dajjal). Al-Dani also narrated it (176/2 - 177/1) and added: (He ate food and walked in the markets).

text: Second: From Abdullah bin Mughaffal who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: (Allah the Exalted has not sent down to earth - since He created Adam until the Hour is established - a trial greater than the trial of the Dajjal. And I have said regarding him a saying no one before me has said: He is dark, curly-haired, with his left eye wiped out, having a thick film on his eye. He cures the blind and the leper and says: 'I am your Lord.' So whoever says: 'My Lord is Allah,' there is no trial upon him. And whoever says: 'You are my lord,' has fallen into trial. He remains among you as long as Allah wills, then Jesus the son of Mary descends, confirming Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, on his religion, a guided Imam and a just judge, so he kills the Dajjal). Al-Hasan used to say: And we see that near the Hour. Narrated by Al-Tabarani in (Al-Kabir) and (Al-Awsat), and its narrators are trustworthy, and regarding some of them there is disagreement that does not harm, as stated in (Majma' Al-Zawa'id) (7/336). The sentence about the eye has a witness from the hadith of Anas with the wording: (The Dajjal is one-eyed in the left eye, having a thick film on it, written between his eyes: Kafir). Narrated by Ahmad (3/115 and 201) with an authentic chain. Third: From Hudhayfah who said: The Dajjal was mentioned in the presence of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, so he said: (I am more fearful for you of the trial of some of you than of the trial of the Dajjal. And no one will be saved from what is

text: Second: From Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (No prophet was sent except that he warned his nation about the one-eyed liar. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (13/85), Muslim (8/195), Abu Dawud (2/213), Al-Tirmidhi (2246) who authenticated it, Ahmad (3/103, 173, 276, 290), Hanbal (f 51/2), Ibn Khuzaimah in (Al-Tawhid) (p. 32), and Ibn Mandah (97/1). text: So I swear that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), Abul-Qasim, the Truthful and Trusted one, said: (It is indeed true, and as for it being near, then everything that is coming is near). Al-Haythami said (7/349): (Narrated by Al-Bazzar and its narrators are the narrators of the (Sahih) except for Ali bin Al-Mundhir, and he is trustworthy). Al-Hafiz said (13/85): (Its chain is good) (1). The hadiths explicitly stating his emergence are many, some of which will come God willing, but they do not contain emphatic words like his saying: (inevitably) or: (It is indeed true). Rather, all the hadiths of the Dajjal confirm his emergence, and his hadith (peace be upon him) is all truth and honesty, whether coupled with an emphatic form or not. {Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination. It is not but a revelation revealed} [An-Najm: 3-4]. Yes, Al-Dani narrated in (Al-Fitan) (141/1) from Al-Hasan in a Mursal form regarding Jesus peace be upon him: (And he is descending inevitably, so if you see him, recognize him...). The hadith was also narrated by Ibn Hibban (1904) from Salih bin Umar: Asim bin Kulayb informed us from his father who said: I heard Abu Huraira saying... and he mentioned it without his saying: (I swear that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him...). And its chain is authentic.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: The sentence about the anger was narrated by Muslim (8/194), Ibn Hibban (6755), and Ahmad (6/284). 5 - For this paragraph, there are many witnesses, of which I will mention what is accessible: First: From Al-Nawwas bin Sam'an who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) mentioned the Dajjal one morning. He lowered [his voice] regarding him and raised it until we thought he was in the cluster of palm trees. He said: (Something other than the Dajjal scares me more for you. If he emerges while I am among you, I am his argument [defender] on your behalf. And if he emerges and I am not among you, then each person is his own defender, and Allah is my successor over every Muslim. He is a young man with curly hair, his eye is floating [blind], as if I liken him to Abdul Uzza bin Qatan. Whoever among you encounters him, let him read the opening verses of Surah (Al-Kahf) [for it is your protection from his tribulation]. He is emerging from a road between the Levant (Sham) and Iraq, spreading corruption to the right and spreading corruption to the left. O servants of Allah, stand firm). We said: O Messenger of Allah, how long will he stay on earth? He said: (Forty days. A day like a year, a day like a month, a day like a week, and the rest of his days like your days). We said: O Messenger of Allah, so that day which is like a year, will the prayer of one day suffice us in it?

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: He said: (No, estimate for it its measure). We said: O Messenger of Allah, and what is his speed in the earth? He said: (Like the rain driven by the wind. He comes to a people and invites them, so they believe in him and respond to him. He commands the sky and it rains, and the earth and it grows vegetation. Their grazing animals return to them with humps as high as possible, udders as full as possible, and flanks as stretched as possible. Then he comes to a people and invites them, but they reject his saying, so he turns away from them. They become drought-stricken, possessing nothing of their wealth. He passes by a ruin and says to it: Extract your treasures. So its treasures follow him like queen bees. Then he calls a man brimming with youth, strikes him with a sword, and cuts him into two pieces [separated by] the distance of an archer's target. Then he calls him, and he comes forward, his face beaming and laughing. While he is like that, Allah sends the Messiah son of Mary. He descends at the white minaret east of Damascus between two yellow garments, placing his palms on the wings of two angels. If he lowers his head, it drips, and if he raises it, drops like pearls fall from it. It is not lawful for a disbeliever to smell the scent of his breath except that he dies, and his breath reaches as far as his sight ends. He seeks him [the Dajjal] until he catches him at the gate of (Ludd) and kills him. Then a people whom Allah has protected from him come to Jesus son of Mary, so he wipes their faces and tells them of their ranks in Paradise. While he is like that, Allah reveals to Jesus: I have brought forth servants of Mine whom no one has the power

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: to fight, so secure My servants to Al-Tur (the Mount). And Allah sends Gog and Magog, and they swarm down from every mound. Their first pass by Lake Tiberias and drink what is in it, and their last pass and say: There was once water here. The Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions are besieged until the head of a bull for one of them is better than a hundred dinars for one of you today. So the Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions beseech Allah, so Allah sends upon them worms (Naghaf) in their necks, and they die as the death of a single soul. Then the Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions descend to the earth [lowland], but they do not find in the earth the space of a hand span except that their fat and stench has filled it. So the Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions beseech Allah, and Allah sends birds like the necks of Bactrian camels, which carry them and throw them where Allah wills. Then Allah sends rain from which no house of clay or hair is shielded, and it washes the earth until it leaves it like a mirror. Then it is said to the earth: Grow your fruits and bring back your blessings. On that day, a group will eat from a pomegranate and seek shade under its peel, and milk will be blessed until a milch camel suffices a large group of people, and a milch cow suffices a tribe of people, and a milch sheep suffices a clan of people. While they are like that, Allah sends a pleasant wind which takes them under their armpits and takes the soul of every believer and every Muslim. The worst of people remain, copulating in it like donkeys, and upon them the Hour will be established). Narrated by Muslim (8/197-198), Abu Dawud (2/213) - with some abbreviation and the addition is his, and his chain is authentic - Al-Tirmidhi (2241), Ibn Majah (2/508-512), Al-Ajurri in (Al-Shari'ah) (p. 376), Ahmad (4/181-182), Hanbal (49/1 - 51/1), Ibn Mandah in (Al-Iman) (94/1), and Ibn Asakir (1/606-609).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Second: From Jubayr bin Nufayr from his father raised [to the Prophet] similarly, without his saying: (We said: O Messenger of Allah, and what is his speed in the earth...). Narrated by Al-Hakim (4/530-531) who said: (Authentic chain). Al-Dhahabi agreed with him. I say: Rather, it is authentic according to the condition of Muslim; all its narrators are trustworthy narrators of his. Al-Haythami said (7/351): (Narrated by Al-Tabarani, and in it is Abdullah bin Salih who has been declared trustworthy and weak by a group, and the rest of its narrators are trustworthy). He mentioned it in another place (7/347-348) up to his saying: (And Allah is my successor over every Muslim) and said: (Narrated by Al-Bazzar, and in it is Abdullah bin Salih, the scribe of Al-Layth, who has been declared trustworthy and weak by a group, and the rest of its narrators are narrators of the (Sahih)). I say: It is in Al-Hakim from other than the route of Ibn Salih, so the Hadith is authentic, praise be to Allah. Third: From Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) entered upon me while I was crying. He said to me: (What makes you cry?) I said: O Messenger of Allah, I remembered the Dajjal and cried. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (If the Dajjal emerges while I am alive, I will suffice you against him. And if the Dajjal emerges after me, then your Lord

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: is not one-eyed. He emerges in the Jewish quarter of Isfahan until he comes to Medina and camps on its outskirts. It will have at that time seven gates; over every mountain pass leading to it are two angels. The evil ones of its people will go out to him until he comes to Palestine at the gate of Ludd. Then Jesus peace be upon him descends and kills him. Then Jesus peace be upon him remains in the earth for forty years as a just leader and a fair judge). Narrated by Ibn Hibban (1905), Ahmad (6/75), his son in (Al-Sunnah) (p. 136), Ibn Mandah (97/2), and Al-Dani (142/2) via Yahya bin Abi Kathir who said: Al-Khadrami bin Lahiq told me: That Dhakwan Abu Salih informed him: That Aisha informed him: ... and he mentioned it. I say: This is an authentic chain. Al-Haythami said (7/338): (And its narrators are the narrators of the (Sahih) except Al-Khadrami bin Lahiq, and he is trustworthy). Fourth: From Umm Salama, the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him), who said: I mentioned the Messiah Dajjal one night and sleep did not come to me. When morning came, I entered upon the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and informed him. He said: (Do not do that, for if he emerges while I am alive, Allah will suffice you against him through me. And if he emerges after I die, Allah will suffice you against him through the righteous). Then he said: (There is no prophet except that he warned his nation about the Dajjal, and I warn you about him: He is one-eyed, and Allah is not one-eyed. He walks on the earth, and the earth and the sky belong to Allah. Lo! The Messiah's right eye is as if it were a floating grape). Narrated by Ibn Khuzaimah (p. 32).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: I say: Its chain is according to the condition of Muslim. Al-Haythami said (7/351): (Narrated by Al-Tabarani and its narrators are trustworthy, except that Al-Tabarani's sheikh Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Nafi' Al-Tahhan, I did not know him). I say: Ibn Khuzaimah's chain is free of him, hence Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir said (1/138): (Al-Dhahabi said: Its chain is strong). 6 - This paragraph is established from the hadith of Al-Nawwas and Nufayr the father of Jubayr, and they have preceded in the previous paragraph. 7 - And in it are hadiths: First: From Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (Shall I not tell you a hadith about the Dajjal that no prophet told his people? He is one-eyed, and he brings with him the semblance of Paradise and Hell. The one he says is Paradise is Hell. And I warn you as Noah warned his people about him). Narrated by Al-Bukhari (6/286), Muslim (8/196), Al-Dani in (Al-Fitan) (f 127/1), and Hanbal (49/1). Al-Tayalisi narrated it (2/218 / 2779) via another route from him.
