Second: From Aisha raised [to the Prophet] with the wording: (As for the tribulation of the Dajjal, there was no prophet except that he warned his nation. And I will warn you about him

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: a warning that no prophet warned his nation: He is one-eyed, and Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed. Written between his eyes: Kafir, which every believer will read). Narrated by Ahmad (6/139-140) and Ibn Mandah (97/2 and 100/1). I say: Its chain is authentic. Third: From Ibn Umar who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (There was no prophet before me except that he described him to his nation. And I will surely describe him with a description that no one before me has described: He is one-eyed, and Allah, Blessed and Exalted, is not one-eyed. His right eye is as if it were a floating grape). Narrated by Ahmad (2/27) and his son in (Al-Sunnah) (140) via Ibn Ishaq from Nafi' from him. Juwayriyah followed him up from Nafi' with it similarly and added. The two Sheikhs and others narrated it from another route from him similarly, and it has passed (p. 51). Fourth: From Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (I will surely describe the Dajjal with a description that no one before me has described: He is one-eyed, and Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed). Narrated by Ahmad (1/176 and 182), his son in (Al-Sunnah) (137), and Al-Dani (130/2) via Muhammad bin Ishaq from Dawud bin Amir bin Sa'd bin Malik from his father from his grandfather.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Its narrators are trustworthy were it not that Ibn Ishaq is a Mudallis (concealer). Abu Ya'la narrated it via his route, as did Al-Bazzar as in (Al-Majma') (7/337). Fifth: From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri: That he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) saying: (Verily, every prophet warned his nation about the Dajjal. And indeed, today he has eaten food. And I am making a covenant [giving a description] that no prophet before me made for his nation: Lo! His right eye is erased of the pupil, protruding, not hidden, as if it were spittle on the side of a wall, and his left eye is like a bright star. With him is the likes of Paradise and the likes of Hell. His Hell is a green garden, and his Paradise is dusty and smoky...) The hadith at length, and in it is the story of the believer whom the Dajjal kills then revives, then cannot kill, which will come. Narrated by Hanbal (47/1-2), Abd bin Hamid (118/2), Abu Ya'la (f 63/1 - library photocopy), Ibn Asakir (1/610-611), and Al-Hakim (4/537-539) who said: (This is the most amazing hadith regarding the mention of Dajjal. Atiyyah bin Sa'd was alone in narrating it from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, and the two Sheikhs did not use Atiyyah as proof). I say: That is due to his weakness. Al-Haythami said (7/337), having attributed it to Al-Bazzar also: (And he has been declared trustworthy). I say: But Mujalid followed him up from Abu Al-Waddak who said: Abu Sa'id said to me: Do the Kharijites believe in the Dajjal? I said: No. He said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: (I am the seal of a thousand prophets, and no prophet was sent who was followed except that he warned his nation about the Dajjal. And indeed, matters of his affair have been clarified to me that were not clarified to anyone else. He is one-eyed, and your Lord is not one-eyed. His right eye is one-eyed and protruding...) The Hadith up to his saying: (smoky). Narrated by Ahmad (3/79). I say: Mujalid is not strong, and Abu Al-Waddak is better than him, so the hadith is Hasan (good) by the sum of the two routes. And Allah knows best. Others narrated it from Abu Al-Waddak with a different wording, and it will come (p. 80). Sixth: From Jabir who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: (No prophet [was sent] except that he warned his nation about the Dajjal. And I will surely tell you something about him that no one before me told). Then he placed his hand on his eyes and said: (I bear witness that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed). Narrated by Al-Hakim (1/24) and Ibn Mandah in (Al-Tawhid) (82/2) who said: (This chain has famous narrators). I say: Its chain is good and its narrators are trustworthy. Ibn Mandah also narrated it in a suspended form (Mu'allaq) from the hadith of Ibn Umar similarly, and in it: (And he pointed with his hand to his eyes) (1). (1) Al-Bukhari connected it (13/332). This addition is witnessed by the hadith of Jabir coming (pp. 89-90) and the hadith of Abu Huraira regarding this verse: {Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due... Indeed, Allah is ever Hearing and Seeing} [An-Nisa: 58]: (I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, placing his thumb on his ear and the finger next to it on his eye. Abu Huraira said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, doing that). Narrated by Abu Dawud (2/277-278), Ibn Khuzaimah in (Al-Tawhid) (p. 31), Al-Hakim (1/24), Al-Bayhaqi in (Al-Asma') (p. 178), and Ibn Mandah also (82/2). He said: (Narrated by Abu Ma'shar from Al-Maqburi from Abu Huraira. And narrated by Ibn Lahi'ah from Yazid bin Abi Habib from Abu Al-Khayr Marthad bin Abdullah from Uqbah bin Amir. And narrated from Al-Hasan bin Thawban from Abu Al-Khayr from Uqbah bin Amir similarly). I say: The chain of Abu Huraira's hadith is authentic on the condition of Muslim, and Al-Hakim, Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz (13/318) said the same. Al-Kawthari criticized it in his commentary on (Al-Asma') without proof, as is his habit with the hadiths of the Attributes.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: And from another route from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (I am the seal of a thousand prophets...) The Hadith is like the one before it without his saying: (And his right eye...) etc. (1). Al-Haythami said (7/347): (Narrated by Al-Bazzar, and in it is Mujalid bin Sa'id; the majority weakened him, but there is authentication for him). Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir said in (Al-Nihayah) (1/128): (Its chain is good and its wording is very strange). 8 - I did not find a significant witness for this paragraph. Sulayman bin Shihab narrated saying: Abdullah bin Mughnam stayed with me - and he was one of the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) - so he narrated to me from the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he said:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: (The Dajjal is not hidden. He comes from the East and calls to me [claims to follow me], so he is followed. He sets himself up for the people, fights them, and prevails over them. He continues like that until he reaches Kufa, where he manifests the religion of Allah and acts by it, so he is followed and loved for that. Then he says after that: I am a prophet. So every person of intellect is terrified by that and leaves him. He remains after that until he says: I am Allah. Then his eye is obliterated, his ear is cut off, and written between his eyes is: Kafir...) The Hadith. Al-Haythami said (7/340-341): (Narrated by Al-Tabarani, and in it is Sa'id bin Muhammad Al-Warraq, who is abandoned [Matruk]). I say: But Al-Hafiz said in (Al-Taqrib): (Weak). Therefore, he said in (Al-Fath) (13/77): (Its chain is weak), so he did not exaggerate in weakening him. Everyone has a direction and a predecessor. And Allah knows best. Ibn Asakir narrated it via his route (1/217-218). Then I found a strong witness for it from the hadith of Abu Huraira raised [to the Prophet] with the wording: (Before the Hour, there will be close to thirty lying Dajjals, all of them saying: I am a prophet, I am a prophet). Narrated by Ahmad (2/429) with this wording, and the two Sheikhs and others with similar wording. Ahmad's chain is authentic. The indication of the hadith and its witnessing for this paragraph is that it is apparent that the Messiah Dajjal is one of these - nay, he is the worst of them. This is supported by the hadith of Samura raised [to the Prophet]:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: (By Allah, the Hour will not be established until thirty liars emerge, the last of them being the one-eyed Dajjal...) The Hadith, and there is weakness in its chain. 9 - This paragraph - without the duality - appeared in hadiths: First: From Umar bin Thabit Al-Ansari: That some companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) informed him: That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said on the day he warned the people about the Dajjal: (It is written between his eyes: Kafir; the one who hates his actions reads it, or every believer reads it) and he said: (Know that none of you will see his Lord, Mighty and Majestic, until he dies). Narrated by Muslim (8/193), Abd al-Razzaq in Al-Musannaf (20820), and from him Al-Tirmidhi (2236) and he authenticated it, as well as Ahmad (5/433) and Al-Dani (129/1-2) without his saying: (or every believer reads it). Second: From Ubadah bin Al-Samit who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (I have told you about the Dajjal until I feared you would not comprehend. The Messiah Dajjal is a short man, pigeon-toed, woolly-haired, one-eyed, an eye that is not protruding nor deep-set. If he confuses you, then know that your Lord, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed, and that you will not see your Lord until you die).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Narrated by Abu Dawud (2/213), Al-Ajurri in (Al-Shari'ah) (p. 375), Abu Nu'aym in (Al-Hilyah) (5/157, 221 and 9/235), and Ibn Mandah in (Al-Tawhid) (83/1). I say: Its chain is good; all its narrators are trustworthy. Al-Haythami said (7/348): (Narrated by Al-Bazzar and in it is Baqiyyah, and he is a Mudallis). I say: He explicitly stated hearing [narrating] in Abu Nu'aym in his three references mentioned, and Ibn Mandah, and also in Abu Dawud, except that the point of witness from it did not occur in his narration, which is his saying: (And that you will not see your Lord until you die). 10 - This paragraph is Mutawatir (mass transmitted) from the Prophet (peace be upon him). It has been narrated by a group of the Companions; the referencing of most of their hadiths has preceded, so I will suffice with referring to their places: First: Abdullah bin Umar (pp. 51, 52, 62). Second: Anas bin Malik (p. 53). Third: Aisha (pp. 59, 61). Fourth: Umm Salama (p. 60). Fifth: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (p. 62). Sixth: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (p. 64). Seventh: Jabir bin Abdullah (p. 64).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Eighth: Ubadah bin Al-Samit (p. 67). Ninth: Asma bint Yazid Al-Ansariyyah, and her hadith will come (pp. 57, 76). Tenth: A man from the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), and it will come as well (p. 71). Eleventh: From Ibn Abbas from the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he said: (The Dajjal: he is one-eyed, white/fair, the most resembling of people to Abdul Uzza bin Qatan. So whoever perishes, perishes [despite clear signs], for your Lord is not one-eyed). Narrated by Ibn Khuzaimah in (Al-Tawhid) (p. 31), Ibn Hibban (1900), Ahmad (1/240, 313), his son in (Al-Sunnah) (p. 137), Al-Tabarani in (Al-Kabir) (11711), Hanbal in (Al-Fitan) (45/1), and Ibn Mandah in (Al-Tawhid) (83/1). I say: Its chain is authentic on the condition of Muslim. 11 - This paragraph came from a group of the Companions: First: Anas bin Malik, and his hadith has passed (p. 53). Second: Aisha, and her hadith has passed (p. 61). Third: Some of his companions (peace be upon him), and his hadith has passed (p. 67). Fourth: Abdullah bin Umar, and his hadith has passed (p. 52). Fifth: Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman, and his hadith has passed (p. 51 footnote). Sixth: Nufayr the father of Jubayr, and the referencing of his hadith has preceded (p. 59).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Seventh: Abu Bakra Al-Thaqafi said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Dajjal is blind in the left eye. Written between his eyes: Kafir, which the illiterate and the literate will read). Narrated by Ahmad (5/38). I say: Its chain is authentic. Al-Haythami said (7/337): (And its narrators are trustworthy). Eighth: From Safina, and it will come (p. 73). Ninth: From Jabir bin Abdullah, and it will come as well (pp. 71-73). Tenth: From Asma bint Yazid Al-Ansariyyah, and it will come (pp. 75-76). 12 - This paragraph is also Mutawatir from the Prophet (peace be upon him). It appeared in the hadiths of most of the Companions whose hadiths I referred to just now. 13 - And this was narrated from a group of the Companions: First: Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Dajjal is blind in the left eye, with thick hair. With him is a paradise and a fire; his fire is paradise and his paradise is fire). He added in a narration: (So whoever enters his river, his reward is removed and his burden is established, and whoever enters his fire, his reward is established and his burden is removed). Narrated by Muslim (8/195), Ibn Majah (2/506), and Ahmad (5/397).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: And the other narration is his (5/403) and its chain is good (Hasan). Al-Hakim authenticated it (4/433) and Al-Dhahabi agreed with him. Abu Dawud narrated it (4244), and it is referenced in (Al-Mishkat) (No. 5396 / Second Verification). Second: A man from the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) saying: (I have warned you about the tribulation of the Dajjal, and there is no prophet except that he warned his people or his nation. He is swarthy, curly-haired, blind in the left eye. He brings rain but does not grow trees. He overpowers a soul and kills it then revives it, but he is not empowered over any other. With him is a paradise, a fire, a river, water, and a mountain of bread. His paradise is fire and his fire is paradise. He stays among you for forty mornings, visiting every watering place except four mosques: the Sacred Mosque [Mecca], the Mosque of Medina, Al-Tur, and Al-Aqsa Mosque. If he confuses you or appears doubtful to you, then Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed). Narrated by Ahmad (5/434, 435) and Hanbal (54/2 - 55/2). I say: Its chain is authentic. Ibn Mandah narrated the first part of it in (Al-Tawhid) (83/1) and added: (So know that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed; Allah is not one-eyed; Allah is not one-eyed). He said: (Its chain has accepted narrators by consensus). Third: From Jabir bin Abdullah who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Dajjal will emerge when religion is light and knowledge is retreating. He has forty nights

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: to travel the earth. A day of them is like a year, a day of them is like a month, and a day of them is like a week, then the rest of his days are like these days of yours. He has a donkey which he rides; the width between its ears is forty cubits. He says to the people: I am your Lord. He is one-eyed, and your Lord is not one-eyed. Written between his eyes: Kafir - K F R spelled out - every believer, literate or illiterate, reads it. He visits every water and watering place except Medina and Mecca; Allah has forbidden them to him, and the angels stand at their gates. With him are mountains of bread, and the people are in hardship except for those who follow him. With him are two rivers - I know them better than he does - a river he says is Paradise and a river he says is Fire. So whoever enters the one he calls Paradise, it is Fire, and whoever enters the one he calls Fire, it is Paradise. (He said): Allah sends devils with him who speak to the people. With him is a great tribulation; he commands the sky and it rains in the eyes of the people, and he kills a soul then revives it in the eyes of the people. He is not empowered over anyone else among the people. He says: O people, does anyone do the like of this except the Lord, Mighty and Majestic? He said: So the Muslims flee to Mount Dukhan in Sham, and he comes to them and besieges them. His siege intensifies and he strains them severely. Then Jesus son of Mary descends and calls out at dawn, saying: O people,

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: what prevents you from going out to the lying, malicious one? They say: This is a jinn. So they go out, and behold, it is Jesus son of Mary (peace be upon him). The prayer is established, and it is said to him: Come forward, O Spirit of Allah. He says: Let your Imam come forward and pray with you. When he prays the Morning Prayer, they go out to him. He said: When the liar sees him, he dissolves just as salt dissolves in water. He walks to him and kills him, such that the tree and stone call out: O Spirit of Allah, this is a Jew. He does not leave anyone who followed him except that he kills him). Narrated by Ahmad (3/367-368): Muhammad bin Sabiq told us: Ibrahim bin Tahman told us from Abu Al-Zubayr from Jabir. Ibn Khuzaimah narrated it in (Al-Tawhid) (pp. 31-32) and Al-Hakim (4/530) via two other routes from Ibrahim, abbreviated. I say: This chain consists of trustworthy narrators, narrators of the (Sahih), except that Abu Al-Zubayr is a Mudallis and narrated it with 'an' (from). Despite that, Al-Hakim said: (Authentic chain) and Al-Dhahabi agreed with him. Fourth: From Safina, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) addressed us and said: (Lo! There was no prophet before me except that he warned his nation about the Dajjal. He is one-eyed in the left eye, and in his right eye is a thick film. Written between his eyes: Kafir. Two valleys go out with him: one is Paradise and the other is Fire; his fire is paradise and his paradise is fire... Then he travels until

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: he comes to the Levant, and Allah, Mighty and Majestic, destroys him at the pass of Afiq). Narrated by Ahmad (5/221-222), Hanbal in (Al-Fitan) (49/1), and Ibn Asakir (1/617). I say: Its chain is good (Hasan) in the context of witnesses. Ibn Kathir said in (Al-Nihayah) (1/124): (Its chain is okay). Fifth: From Abu Huraira, and its wording has passed being referenced (p. 61). 14 - This paragraph appeared in two hadiths without [the mention of] seeking aid (Istighatha): First: From Al-Nawwas bin Sam'an, and it has passed (pp. 56-58). Second: From Nufayr the father of Jubayr, and it has passed (p. 59). 15 - I have not found yet what witnesses for this paragraph. If it were established, it would be explicit that the fire of the Dajjal is real fire and not a deception from him, may Allah curse him. Yes, Al-Dani narrated in (Al-Fitan) (134/2) from Al-Asbagh bin Nubatah from Ali in a hadith of his, suspended (Mawquf): (Whoever is tested by his fire, let him read the end of Surah (Al-Kahf), and the fire will become cool and safe upon him... and his followers on that day will be the people of usury - ten for twelve - and children of fornication). However, Al-Asbagh is abandoned (Matruk) and extremely weak, so he is not fit to be cited as a witness.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: 16 - This paragraph is witnessed by two hadiths: First: The hadith of Asma bint Yazid Al-Ansariyyah, narrated by Shahr bin Hawshab from her, she said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came to me among a group of his companions and mentioned the Dajjal. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (Before he emerges, there are three years. The sky holds back one-third of its rain in the first year, and the earth one-third of its vegetation. In the second year, the sky holds back two-thirds of its rain and the earth two-thirds of its vegetation. In the third year, the sky holds back what is in it, and the earth what is in it, until every creature with a molar or hoof perishes. One of his severest tribulations is that he says to the Bedouin: What do you think if I revive your camel for you, huge, with long udders and humps, chewing the cud, would you acknowledge that I am your Lord? He says: Yes. He said: So the devils represent themselves to him [in the form of his camel, so he follows him]. He said: And he says to the man: What do you think if I revive your father, your brother, and your mother, would you acknowledge that I am your Lord? He says: Yes. He said: So the devils represent themselves to him [in their forms, so he follows him]. He said: Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) went out for his need, and I placed water for ablution for him. The people wailed until their voices rose. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) took hold of the two sides (or in a narration: jambs) of the door and said: (Mahyam?) [What is the matter?]. [And it was a word the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to say when asking about a matter: (Mahyam). Asma said:] I said: O Messenger of Allah, you have torn out

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: their hearts due to the Dajjal. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: ([There is no harm upon you] If he emerges while I am among you, I am his argument [opponent] against him. And if I die, then Allah is my successor over every believer). [She said: I said: Will our hearts be with us on that day, O Messenger of Allah? He said: (Yes, or better. It is that the fruits of the lands will be fulfilled to him and he will feed them). She said: By Allah, my family prepares their dough, and it doesn't bake until I fear I will be tempted by hunger.] And what will suffice the believers on that day? He said: (It suffices them what suffices the people of heaven). [She said: O Prophet of Allah, we know that the angels do not eat or drink. He said: (But they glorify and sanctify [Allah], and that is the food and drink of the believers on that day] Glorification and Sanctification. [So whoever attends my gathering and hears my words, let the present convey to the absent. And know that Allah is sound, not one-eyed, and that the Dajjal is one-eyed, with an erased eye. Written between his eyes: Kafir, which every believer, literate or illiterate, will read]). Narrated by Abd al-Razzaq in (Al-Musannaf) (11/391 / 20821), Al-Tayalisi (2/217 / 2775), Ahmad (6/453, 454, 455), Hanbal bin Ishaq Al-Shaybani in (Al-Fitan) (f 45/1-2 and 46/1), Ibn Asakir in (Al-Tarikh) (1/616-617), Abdullah in (Al-Sunnah) (141), and Abu Amr Al-Dani in (Al-Fitan) (126/1) the last part of it via routes from Shahr with it.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Ibn Kathir said (1/135): (And this chain is okay). In a narration by Ahmad (6/454), Hanbal (54/1-2), and Abd al-Razzaq also (20822) via the route of Ibn Khuthaym from Shahr with it raised [to the Prophet] with the wording: (The Dajjal stays on earth forty years; the year is like a month, the month is like a week, the week is like a day, and the day is like the burning of a palm frond in fire). Al-Haythami said (7/347): (Narrated by Al-Tabarani, and in it is Shahr bin Hawshab, and his contradiction of authentic hadiths cannot be tolerated: that he stays on earth forty days. While in this [it says] forty years. And the rest of its narrators are trustworthy). Second: The hadith of Jabir previously mentioned (pp. 71-73), and in it: (And Allah sends devils with him who speak to the people). 17 - Contains hadiths: First: From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) told us a long hadith about the Dajjal, and said among what he told us: (The Dajjal comes, and it is forbidden for him to enter the mountain passes of Medina. So a man [brimming with youth] goes out to him on that day [from the believers], he is the best of people or among the best of them

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: and says: I testify that you are the Dajjal whom the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) told us about. The Dajjal says: What do you think if I kill this one and then revive him, will you doubt in the matter? They say: No. So he kills him then revives him. He says when he is revived: By Allah, I was never more insightful about you than I am now. He said: So he wants to kill him a second time, but he is not empowered over him). Narrated by Abd al-Razzaq (20824): Ma'mar informed us from Al-Zuhri who said: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah informed me: That Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: ... and he mentioned it and added: (Ma'mar said: It reached me that he places a sheet of copper on his throat. And it reached me that he is Al-Khidr whom the Dajjal kills and then revives). From the route of Abd al-Razzaq, Ibn Hibban (6763) [narrated it]. And Ahmad (3/36) also narrated it from Abd al-Razzaq without the mentioned statement of Ma'mar. Likewise, Al-Bukhari (13/86-88), Muslim (8/199), and Ibn Mandah (95/1) narrated it from other routes from Al-Zuhri with it. Muslim added: (Abu Ishaq said: It is said: This man is Al-Khidr peace be upon him). I say: This Abu Ishaq is Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Sufyan Al-Zahid, the narrator of (Sahih Muslim) from him, as affirmed by Al-Hafiz (13/88-89) following Iyad, Al-Nawawi, and others. I say: His predecessor in that is the report of Ma'mar mentioned earlier, and there is no proof in it because it is a report (Balagh) whose speaker is unknown, and even if known, it is disconnected (Maqtu'). And Al-Khidr died before the Prophet (peace be upon him)

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: and he did not reach him according to the most correct view among the verifiers. Therefore, Ibn Al-Arabi said: (I heard someone say: The one whom the Dajjal kills is Al-Khidr. This is a claim with no proof). Second: From a man from the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), and it has passed (p. 71), and in it: (And he overpowers a soul and kills it then revives it, but he is not empowered over any other). Third: From Al-Nawwas bin Sam'an, and it has passed (pp. 56-58), and in it: (Then he calls a man brimming with youth, strikes him with a sword, and cuts him into two pieces [separated by] the distance of an archer's target. Then he calls him, and he comes forward, his face beaming and laughing). Fourth: From Abdullah bin Mughnam, and the first part of his hadith has passed (p. 66). Its completion is: (Then he calls for a man - as they see - and orders him to be killed, then cuts his limbs, each limb separately. He separates them until the people see him, then gathers them, then strikes with his staff, and behold he is standing. He says: I am Allah, I give life and cause death. And all of that is magic by which he bewitches the eyes of the people; he does nothing of that in reality). I say: Its chain is weak, and in this context, it is denounced (Munkar). And Allah knows best. Fifth: From Abdullah bin Amr, and it will come in the next paragraph.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: 18 - Contains two hadiths: First: From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Dajjal emerges, and a man from the believers heads towards him. The armed guards - the guards of Dajjal - meet him and say to him: Where do you intend? He says: I intend to this one who has emerged. He said: They say to him: Do you not believe in our lord? He says: There is nothing hidden about our Lord. They say: Kill him. Then some of them say to others: Did your lord not forbid you to kill anyone without him? He said: So they take him to the Dajjal. When the believer sees him, he says: O people, this is the Dajjal whom the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) mentioned. He said: The Dajjal orders him to be laid out on his stomach and says: Take him and beat him. So his back and stomach are beaten severely. He said: Then he says: Do you not believe in me? He said: He says: You are the lying Messiah. He said: He orders him to be sawed with a saw from the parting of his hair until his legs are separated. He said: Then the Dajjal walks between the two pieces, then says to him: Stand up. So he stands up straight. He said: Then he says to him: Do you believe in me? He says: I have only increased in insight regarding you. He said: Then he says: O people, he will not do this to anyone after me among the people. He said: The Dajjal takes him to slaughter him, but the area between his neck and his collarbone is made into copper, so he finds no way to him. He said: So he takes him by his hands and feet and casts him. The people think he cast him into the Fire, but he was thrown into Paradise). The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (This is the greatest of people in martyrdom with the Lord of the Worlds). Narrated by Muslim (8/200) and Ibn Mandah (95/1) via Qais bin Wahb from Abu Al-Waddak from him.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: And Al-Hakim and others who preceded (p. 63) narrated it via Atiyyah from him similarly. And the other: From Abdullah bin Amr from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him): That he said regarding the Dajjal: (Whatever is confused for you regarding him, then Allah is not one-eyed. He emerges and stays on earth forty mornings, visiting every watering place except the Kaaba, Bayt al-Maqdis, and Medina. The month is like a week, and the week is like a day. With him is a paradise and a fire; his fire is paradise and his paradise is fire. With him is a mountain of bread and a river of water. He calls a man, but Allah does not empower him except over him. He says: What do you say about me? He says: You are the enemy of Allah and you are the lying Dajjal. So he calls for a saw and places it at his head and splits him until he falls to the ground. Then he revives him and says: What do you say? He says: By Allah, I was never more insightful about you than I am now. You are the enemy of Allah, the Dajjal whom the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) told us about. He said: So he lunges at him with his sword but cannot [harm] him, so he says: Remove him from me). Al-Haythami said (7/350): (Narrated by Al-Tabarani, and in it are those whom I do not know). Therefore, Al-Dhahabi considered it strange (Gharib), as quoted by Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir in (Al-Nihayah) (1/134). (Note): In these two hadiths, the believing man is sawed by the Dajjal with a saw, and in the hadith of Al-Nawwas previously mentioned, he (strikes him with a sword and cuts him into two pieces). Al-Hafiz said (13/87): Ibn Al-Arabi said:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: (So it is reconciled that they are two men, he kills each of them with a killing different from the other). Al-Hafiz said: (So he said, but the principle is lack of multiplicity. The narration of the saw explains the narration of the strike with the sword. Perhaps the sword had notches so it became like a saw, and he intended exaggeration in torturing him with the mentioned killing. His saying: (so he struck him with the sword) explains his saying: that he sawed him. And his saying: (and cut him into two pieces) is an indication of the end of his matter when his sawing is finished). 19 - Witnessed by two hadiths: First: The hadith of Al-Nawwas bin Sam'an previously mentioned (pp. 56-58). The other: The hadith of Asma bint Yazid Al-Ansariyyah previously mentioned also (pp. 75-76). 20 - Also witnessed by the two hadiths referred to just now. 21 - Also witnessed by the two referred hadiths. 22 - This paragraph came in the hadiths of a group of the Companions: First: Anas bin Malik, and his hadith will come in the referencing of paragraph (24) (p. 90). Second: Fatima bint Qais in the story of Al-Jassasah and the Dajjal (1) from the narration of Tamim Al-Dari, and in it that the Dajjal said: (1) Know that this story is authentic - indeed Mutawatir - Tamim Al-Dari was not alone in narrating it as some ignorant people among the commentators on (Al-Nihayah) by Ibn Kathir (p. 96 - Riyadh edition) think. Abu Huraira, Aisha, and Jabir followed him in it as will come (pp. 83 and 87).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: (And I inform you about myself: I am the Messiah, and I am about to be permitted to emerge. So I will emerge and travel in the earth, and I will not leave a town except that I descend upon it in forty nights, except Mecca and Taybah [Medina], for they are both forbidden to me. Whenever I want to enter one - or: one - of them, an angel confronts me with an unsheathed sword in his hand, blocking me from it. And over every mountain pass of it are angels guarding it. She said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said - striking the pulpit with his staff -: This is Taybah, this is Taybah, this is Taybah (meaning: Medina). Did I not tell you that?). The people said: Yes. He said: (Indeed, the hadith of Tamim pleased me, that it agreed with what I was telling you about him and about Medina and Mecca). Narrated by Muslim (8/205) and Ahmad (6/413 and 418). Al-Tayalisi also narrated it (2/218-219) abbreviated, Abu Dawud (2/214-215), Hanbal (44/2 - 45/1), and Ibn Mandah (98/1-2) via routes from Amir Al-Sha'bi from her. Also narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (2254), Ibn Majah (2/506-508), and Al-Ajurri (pp. 376-379) abbreviated, but they did not mention Mecca. It is a narration of Imam Ahmad (6/373-374) and Ibn Mandah (97/2). Third: Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her). Al-Sha'bi said in the last narration of Ahmad just mentioned: I met Al-Muharrar bin Abu Huraira and told him the hadith of Fatima bint Qais. He said:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: I bear witness regarding my father that he told me just as Fatima told you, except that he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (He is towards the East). He said: Then I met Al-Qasim bin Muhammad and mentioned the hadith of Fatima to him. He said: I bear witness regarding Aisha that she told me just as Fatima told you, except that she said: (The two sanctuaries are forbidden to him: Mecca and Medina). Narrated (6/373-374 and 417-418) via the route of Mujalid from Amir. And Mujalid - who is Ibn Sa'id - is not strong, and he did not preserve the mention of Mecca in Fatima's hadith, so he differentiated between her hadith and Aisha's hadith, while they are in reality in agreement because the mention of Mecca is established in Fatima's hadith as well in Muslim and others as previously mentioned via routes from Amir from her. In a narration by Ahmad (6/241) via the route of Dawud - who is Ibn Abi Hind - from Amir from Aisha raised [to the Prophet] abbreviated with the wording: (The Dajjal will not enter Mecca nor Medina). I say: Its chain is authentic on the condition of Muslim. Ibn Mandah narrated similar to it. Fourth: From Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (Over the mountain passes of Medina are angels; plague will not enter it nor the Dajjal). Narrated by Al-Bukhari (4/76), Muslim (4/120), Ahmad (2/237, 331), and Al-Dani (128/2) via routes from him.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: And in another route by Ahmad (2/483) with the wording: (Medina and Mecca are surrounded by angels, on every mountain pass of it...). And in another by Muslim and also Abu Ya'la (292/2 - library photocopy): (The Messiah comes from the East intending Medina until he camps behind Uhud. Then the angels turn his face towards the Levant, and there he perishes). Fifth: Abu Bakra Al-Thaqafi said: People talked a lot about Musaylimah before the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said anything about him. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stood delivering a sermon and said: (As for what follows, regarding the matter of this man about whom you have talked much - indeed he is a liar among thirty liars who will emerge before the Hour. And indeed, there is no town except that the terror of the Messiah reaches it except Medina; on every mountain pass of its passes are two angels repelling the terror of the Messiah from it). Narrated by Abd al-Razzaq (20823) and Ahmad (5/41 and 47) from him and from others from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Talhah bin Abdullah bin Awf from him. I say: This chain appears authentic, for its narrators are trustworthy narrators of Al-Bukhari. However, two trustworthy narrators opposed Ma'mar, namely Aqil - who is Ibn Khalid Al-Ayli - and the nephew of Ibn Shihab - whose name is Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Muslim. They said: From Ibn Shihab from Talhah: That Iyad bin Musafi' informed him from Abu Bakra. Narrated by Ahmad (5/46).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: I say: This is more correct (1). And this Iyad is unknown (Majhul), but he has been followed up on the last part of it. Ibrahim bin Sa'd narrated from his father from his grandfather from Abu Bakra (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: (The terror of the Messiah Dajjal will not enter Medina. It will have at that time seven gates; on every gate are two angels). Narrated by Al-Bukhari (4/76) and Ahmad (5/43 and 47). Al-Hakim (4/542) included it [in Al-Mustadrak thinking it fits criteria but was missed], but he was mistaken [as it is in Bukhari]. It has a witness from the hadith of Abu Huraira in Al-Bukhari also number (5731) via the route of Malik, and this is in (Al-Muwatta) (3/88). Sixth: A man from the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), and his hadith has passed (p. 71). Seventh: Jabir bin Abdullah, and his hadith has passed also (pp. 71-73), and it will come via another route soon. Eighth: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, and it has passed (pp. 77-78). Ninth: Abdullah bin Amr, and it has passed also (p. 81). Tenth: From Anas like the hadith of Abu Huraira in the two Sheikhs. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (7134), Al-Tirmidhi (2243), Ibn Hibban (6766), (1) Then I saw that Al-Hakim narrated the hadith (4/541) via the route of Abd al-Razzaq and others from Ma'mar with it and said: (Ma'mar and Shu'ayb bin Abi Hamzah disconnected this chain from Al-Zuhri, for Talhah bin Abdullah bin Awf did not hear it from Abu Bakra; rather, he heard it from Iyad bin Musafi' from Abu Bakra. Thus it was narrated by Yunus bin Yazid and Aqil bin Khalid from Al-Zuhri). Then he cited his chain to them.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: and Ahmad (3/202, 206, 277). 23 - Contains hadiths: First: From Fatima bint Qais, and I mentioned its wording recently (pp. 82-83). Second: From Jabir also who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stood one day on the pulpit and said: (O people, I did not stand among you due to news that came to me from the sky (and he mentioned the hadith of Al-Jassasah briefly, and in it:) He said: He is the Messiah; the earth is folded for him in forty days except what was of Taybah). The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (And Taybah is Medina. There is no gate of its gates except there is an angel upon it with his sword unsheathed preventing him. And Mecca is like that). Narrated by Abu Ya'la in his (Musnad) (p. 112/2 and 113/2) via two routes from Muhammad bin Fudayl: Al-Walid bin Jumay' told us from Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman from him. I say: This chain is good and it is on the condition of Muslim. Al-Haythami said (7/346): (Narrated by Abu Ya'la with two chains, the narrators of one of them are the narrators of the (Sahih)). Third: Mihjan bin Al-Adra' said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent me for a need, then met me in some roads of Medina. Then he climbed Uhud and I climbed with him. He turned his face towards Medina and said something to it, then said: (Woe to its mother - or: Woe to her mother - a village whose people leave it when it is most ripe, the birds

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: and beasts will eat it. It eats its fruit and the Dajjal will not enter it, if Allah wills. Whenever he wants to enter it, he is met at every mountain pass of its passes by an angel with an unsheathed sword preventing him from it). Narrated by Al-Hakim (4/427) who said: (Authentic chain) and Al-Dhahabi agreed with him. I say: It has a disconnection as will be explained. 24 - Contains hadiths: First: From Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Dajjal descends in this salt flat at Marr Qanat. Most of those who go out to him will be women, until a man returns to his intimate relative, to his mother, daughter, sister, and aunt, and ties her up with a rope fearing she will go out to him. Then Allah empowers the Muslims over him, so they kill him and kill his followers, until the Jew hides under the tree or stone, and the stone or tree says to the Muslim: This is a Jew under me, so kill him). Narrated by Ahmad (2/67) and Hanbal in (Al-Fitan) (51/2 - 52/1). I say: Its chain is good were it not for the 'an'anah (narrating with 'from') of Muhammad bin Ishaq. Second: From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri raised [to the Prophet]: (The Dajjal comes - and it is forbidden for him to enter the mountain passes of Medina - so he camps at some of the salt flats near Medina. A man goes out to him on that day...) The Hadith. Narrated by the two Sheikhs and others, and it has passed with the wording of Abd al-Razzaq (pp. 77-78).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: Third: From Mihjan bin Al-Adra': That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) addressed the people and said: (The Day of Deliverance, and what is the Day of Deliverance? The Day of Deliverance, and what is the Day of Deliverance? The Day of Deliverance, and what is the Day of Deliverance?) (Three times). It was said to him: And what is the Day of Deliverance? He said: (The Dajjal comes and climbs Uhud, looks at Medina and says to his companions: Do you see this white palace? This is the mosque of Ahmad. Then he comes to Medina and finds at every mountain pass of it an angel with an unsheathed sword. So he comes to the salt flat of Al-Jurf and pitches his tent. Then Medina shakes with three tremors, and no hypocrite male or female, nor wicked male or female remains except that they go out to him. That is the Day of Deliverance). Narrated by Ahmad (4/338), Hanbal (46/2 - 47/1), and Al-Hakim (4/427 and 543) who said: (Authentic on the condition of Muslim) and Al-Dhahabi agreed with him. It is as they said if it is free from disconnection between Abdullah bin Shaqiq and Mihjan. Raja' bin Abi Raja' Al-Bahili was introduced between them in a narration by Ahmad and Hanbal (46/1), and its chain is more authentic than the chain of the first narration, but it is in any case okay in witnesses. Fourth: From Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) looked over a crevice of the Harra (volcanic rock field) and we were with him. He said: (What a good land is Medina. If the Dajjal emerges, on every mountain pass of its passes is an angel

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: he will not enter it. When that happens, Medina will shake with its people with three tremors. No hypocrite male or female will remain except that they go out to him. And the majority - meaning - those who go out to him are women. That is the Day of Deliverance. That is the day Medina expels filth just as the bellows expel the filth of iron. With him are seventy thousand Jews; on every man of them is a robe (Saj) and an adorned sword. His neck will be struck with this strike at the confluence of the torrents). Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (There was no tribulation - nor will there be until the Hour is established - greater than the tribulation of the Dajjal. And no prophet [was sent] except that he warned his nation. And I will surely tell you something no prophet told his nation before me). Then he placed his hand on his eye then said: (I bear witness that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not one-eyed). Narrated by Ahmad (3/292) and his son in (Al-Sunnah) (138). I say: Its narrators are trustworthy narrators of the two Sheikhs except Zuhair - who is Ibn Muhammad Al-Khurasani - and in him is weakness. Ibn Kathir said (1/127): (Its chain is good and Al-Hakim authenticated it). It has another route abbreviated in (Al-Ihsan) (6616). Fifth: From Anas bin Malik who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Dajjal comes and treads the earth except Mecca and Medina. He comes to Medina and finds at every mountain pass of its passes rows of angels. He comes to the salt flat of Al-Jurf and pitches his tent.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: So Medina will shake with three tremors, and every hypocrite male and female will go out to him). Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1/466 - Europe), Muslim (8/206-207), Ahmad (3/191, 206, 238, 292), Hanbal (47/1 - 48/2), and Al-Dani in (Al-Fitan) (127/2 - 128/1). 25 - Contains three hadiths: First: From Anas. Second: From Jabir. Third: From Mihjan. All three have passed just now. Fourth from a man from the Ansar from some companions of Muhammad (peace be upon him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) mentioned the Dajjal and said: (He comes to the salt flats of Medina, and it is forbidden for him to enter its mountain passes. So Medina shakes with its people once or twice - and it is the earthquake - and every hypocrite male and female goes out to him from it. Then the Dajjal turns towards the Levant until he comes to some of the mountains of the Levant and besieges them. The remainder of the Muslims on that day are fortified on the peak of a mountain of the mountains of the Levant. The Dajjal besieges them, camping at its base. When the tribulation becomes prolonged upon them, a man from the Muslims says: O assembly of Muslims, until when are you like this while the enemy of Allah is camping in your land like this? Are you [waiting for anything] but one of the two good things: either Allah grants you martyrdom or He grants you victory? So they pledge

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: upon death, a pledge that Allah knows is truthful from themselves. Then darkness seizes them such that a man cannot see his palm. He said: Then the son of Mary descends, and [the darkness] is lifted from their eyes, and among them is a man wearing armor. They say: Who are you, O servant of Allah? He says: I am the servant of Allah and His Messenger, His Spirit, and His Word, Jesus son of Mary. Choose one of three: either Allah sends a punishment from the sky upon the Dajjal and his soldiers, or the earth swallows them, or He empowers your weapons over them and restrains their weapons from you. They say: This, O Messenger of Allah, is most healing for our chests and ourselves. On that day, you will see the huge, tall, gluttonous, heavy-drinking Jew, his hand cannot hold his sword due to trembling. So they rise against them and overpower them. The Dajjal melts when he sees the son of Mary as lead melts, until Jesus comes to him or catches him and kills him). Narrated by Abd al-Razzaq (20834) from Amr bin Abi Sufyan Al-Thaqafi from him. I say: Its chain consists of trustworthy narrators of the two Sheikhs except the Ansari man, for he was not named. It is possible he is a Companion because this Al-Thaqafi is a Tabi'i who narrated from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari and others. If that is so, the chain is authentic because the anonymity of a Companion does not harm according to Ahl al-Sunnah. 26 - Witnessed by two hadiths: First: The hadith of Jabir previously mentioned (pp. 89-90) and in it: (That is the Day of Deliverance. That is the day Medina expels filth just as the bellows expel the filth of iron).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: And the other: The hadith of Abu Huraira: That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (Lo! Medina is like the bellows; it expels the impure. The Hour will not be established until Medina expels its evil ones just as the bellows expel the filth of iron). Narrated by Muslim (4/120). 27 - Contains two hadiths: First: The hadith of Mihjan bin Al-Adra', and it has passed (p. 89). The other: The hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, and it has passed also (pp. 89-90). 28 - Contains two hadiths also: First: From Umm Sharik herself who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) saying: (The people will surely flee from the Dajjal into the mountains). Umm Sharik said: O Messenger of Allah, where will the Arabs be on that day? He said: (They are few). Narrated by Muslim (8/207), Al-Tirmidhi (3926) (1), and Ahmad (6/462). The other: From Aisha: That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) mentioned a severe hardship that will be before the Dajjal. I said: O Messenger of Allah, where will the Arabs be on that day? He said: (1) I say: Professor Al-Da'as missed that it is in (Muslim), so he said in his commentary on (Al-Tirmidhi): (Al-Tirmidhi was solitary in narrating it).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: (O Aisha, the Arabs on that day will be few). I said: What will suffice the believers on that day regarding food? He said: (What suffices the angels: Glorification [Tasbih], Magnification [Takbir], Praise [Tahmid], and Declaration of Oneness [Tahlil]). I said: So what wealth is best on that day? He said: (A strong young servant who gives water to his family, but as for food, there is no food). Narrated by Ahmad (6/125), Hanbal (47/2), and Abu Ya'la (3/1133) via Hammad bin Salamah from Ali bin Zaid from Al-Hasan from her. I say: This chain is weak. Al-Hasan - who is Al-Basri - is a Mudallis, and Ali bin Zaid - who is Ibn Jud'an - is weak. Al-Haythami overlooked this, saying (7/335): (Narrated by Ahmad and Abu Ya'la, and its narrators are the narrators of the (Sahih)). 29 - I did not find a witness for it. 30 - Witnessed by the hadith of Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: (The Mahdi is from us, the Ahl al-Bayt; Allah will rectify him in a night). It is an established hadith referenced in (Al-Sahihah) (2371). 31 - This paragraph is witnessed by hadiths: First: From Uthman bin Abi Al-Aas who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) saying: (There will be three garrison cities/regions for the Muslims: A garrison at the meeting of the two seas, a garrison in Hira,

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: and a garrison in the Levant. People will be terrified with three frights. Then the Dajjal emerges in the anger of people. He is defeated from the East. The first garrison he comes to is the garrison at the meeting of the two seas. Its people become three groups: a group that says: 'Let us see what he is?', a group that joins the Bedouins, and a group that joins the garrison next to them. With the Dajjal are seventy thousand wearing woolen garments (Sijan). Most of his followers are Jews and women. Then he comes to the garrison next to them, and its people become three groups: a group that says: 'Let us see what he is?', a group that joins the Bedouins, and a group that joins the garrison next to them in western Sham. The Muslims retreat to the pass of Afiq. They send out their grazing animals, but their animals are stricken. That becomes severe upon them, and they are afflicted with severe famine and severe hardship, until one of them burns the string of his bow and eats it. While they are like that, a caller calls out at dawn: 'O people, the Helper (Al-Ghawth) has come' (three times). Some of them say to others: 'Indeed, this is the voice of a satiated man.' Jesus son of Mary (peace be upon him) descends at the time of the Dawn Prayer. Their leader says to him: 'O Spirit of Allah, come forward and pray.' He says: 'This nation, some of them are leaders over others.' So their leader comes forward and prays. When he finishes his prayer, Jesus takes his spear and goes towards the Dajjal. When the Dajjal sees him, he melts as lead melts. So he places his spear between his nipples and kills him. His companions are defeated, and on that day nothing will hide anyone of them, to the point that the tree will say to him: 'O believer, this is a disbeliever.' And the stone will say: 'O believer, this is a disbeliever'). Narrated by Ahmad (4/216-217) and Al-Hakim (4/478-479).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: I say: And its narrators are trustworthy narrators of Muslim except Ali bin Zaid - who is Ibn Jud'an - and he is weak. Second: From Jabir bin Abdullah, and his hadith has passed (71-73). Muslim (1/95) narrated the point of witness from it via another route from Abu Al-Zubayr: That he heard Jabir bin Abdullah raised [to the Prophet] with the wording: (A group of my nation will not cease fighting upon the truth, victorious until the Day of Resurrection. He said: Then Jesus son of Mary (peace be upon him) descends, and their leader says: Come, pray for us. He says: No, some of you are leaders over others, an honor from Allah for this nation). It is referenced in (Al-Sahihah) (1960). Al-Dani also narrated it (142/2). Third: From Abu Huraira, and his hadith has passed (p. 54) with the wording: (Then Jesus son of Mary (peace be upon him) descends from the sky and leads the people. When he raises his head from his bowing, he says: Allah hears those who praise Him. Allah will kill the Messiah Dajjal and the Muslims will prevail). Fourth: From Al-Nawwas bin Sam'an, and his hadith has passed (pp. 56-58). Fifth: From Aisha, and her hadith has passed (pp. 59-60). Sixth: Some companions of Muhammad (peace be upon him), and it has passed (91-92). Seventh: From Samura: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to say: (Indeed, the Dajjal is emerging, and he is blind in the left eye upon which is a thick film. And he cures

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: the blind and the leper, and revives the dead, and says to people: I am your Lord. So whoever says: You are my Lord: has been tempted. And whoever says: My Lord is Allah, until he dies, has been protected from his tribulation; there is no tribulation after it nor punishment upon him. He stays as long as Allah wills. Then Jesus son of Mary, peace be upon them both, comes from the West confirming Muhammad (peace be upon him) and upon his religion. He kills the Dajjal, then it is indeed the establishment of the Hour). Narrated by Ahmad (5/13). I say: Its chain is authentic were it not for the 'an'anah of Al-Hasan Al-Basri. However, Al-Hafiz in (Al-Fath) (6/478) affirmed that its chain is good. Eighth: From Abu Huraira also: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: (How will you be when the son of Mary descends [from the sky] among you and your Imam (and in a narration: and leads you) is from you?). Ibn Abi Dhi'b - one of its narrators - said: Do you know what (leads you from you) is? Leads you by the Book of your Lord, Blessed and Exalted, and the Sunnah of your Prophet (peace be upon him). Narrated by Al-Bukhari (6/384), Muslim (1/94), Abd al-Razzaq (20841), Ahmad (2/272, 336), Ibn Mandah (41/2), and Al-Bayhaqi in (Al-Asma') (p. 424), and the addition is his. And from a second route from him raised [to the Prophet] with the wording: (By the One in whose Hand is my soul, the son of Mary will surely descend among you as a just judge. He will break the cross, kill the swine, abolish war, and wealth will overflow until no one accepts it,

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: until a single prostration is better than the world and what is in it). Then Abu Huraira says: Read if you wish: {And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in him before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness} [An-Nisa: 159]. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (6/382-383), Muslim (93-94), Al-Tirmidhi (2234) and he authenticated it, Al-Tayalisi (2/219 / 2782), and Ahmad (2/240, 272, 538). These three do not have the recitation of the verse. It is a narration of the two Sheikhs, Ibn Majah (2/516), Al-Ajurri (p. 381), Abd al-Razzaq (20840), Al-Dani (142/1-2), and Ibn Mandah in (Al-Iman) (41/1). And from a third route from him with the wording: (By Allah, the son of Mary will surely descend as a just judge. He will surely break the cross, kill the swine, abolish the Jizya [tax], leave the young camels so no one strives for them, and hatred, mutual hatred, and envy will surely disappear. He will surely call to wealth, but no one will accept it). Narrated by Muslim (1/94), Ahmad (2/494), Al-Ajurri (p. 380), and Ibn Mandah (41/2). And in a fourth - which is from Muhammad bin Sirin - from him raised [to the Prophet]: (Whoever lives among you is about to meet Jesus son of Mary as a guided leader and a just judge. He will break the cross, kill the swine, abolish the Jizya, and war will lay down its burdens). Narrated by Ahmad (2/411).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: I say: And its chain is authentic on the condition of the two Sheikhs. In a narration from Ibn Sirin, he said: (The son of Mary descends upon his nation and two yellow garments [Methnawi?] between the Adhan and the Iqamah. They say to him: Come forward. He says: Rather, your Imam should lead you in prayer; you are leaders over one another). Narrated by Abd al-Razzaq (20838). Its chain is authentic Maqtu' (stopped at the Tabi'i), and it has the ruling of being raised (Marfu') as Mursal. In another narration from Ma'mar, he said: (Ibn Sirin used to view that the Mahdi is the one behind whom Jesus prays). Narrated by Abd al-Razzaq (20839). In a fifth route from Abu Huraira raised [to the Prophet] with the wording: (Jesus son of Mary descends, kills the swine, obliterates the cross, the prayer is gathered for him, he gives wealth until it is not accepted, he abolishes the Kharaj [tax], and camps at Al-Rawha', performing Hajj or Umrah from there, or combining them both). He said: And Abu Huraira recited: {And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in him before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness} [An-Nisa: 159]. Hanzala claimed that Abu Huraira said: (believe in him before his death): Jesus. I do not know if all of this is the hadith of the Prophet (peace be upon him) or something Abu Huraira said? Narrated by Ahmad (2/290-291). I say: Its chain is authentic on the condition of Muslim. He extracted from it his descending at (Al-Rawha')

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, peace be upon him
text: and raising the voice in Talbiyah (4/60). Likewise, Abd al-Razzaq (20842), Al-Dani (144/1), and Ibn Mandah (41/2) narrated it. In a sixth [narration] from him raised [to the Prophet]: (There is no prophet between me and him (meaning: Jesus), and he is descending. If you see him, recognize him: a man of medium height, reddish-white, between two yellowish garments, as if his head is dripping though no moisture touched it. He will fight the people for Islam, break the cross, kill the swine, and abolish the Jizya. Allah will destroy in his time all religions except Islam, and [Allah will destroy in his time] the Messiah [the Liar] Al-Dajjal. [And security will fall upon the earth until lions graze with camels, tigers with cows, and wolves with sheep, and children play with snakes without them harming them]. He will remain on earth for forty years, then he will die and the Muslims will pray over him [and bury him]). Narrated by Abu Dawud (2/214) and the context is his, Ibn Hibban (1902 and 1903), Ahmad (2/406 and 437), Ibn Jarir in (Al-Tafsir) (No. 7145), Al-Ajurri (p. 380), and Abd al-Razzaq (20845) who added: (And the call will be one for the Lord of the Worlds). It has a witness in the following route. I say: Its chain is authentic and Al-Hafiz authenticated it. It is referenced in (Silsilat Al-Ahadith Al-Sahihah) (2182). In a seventh [narration] from him raised [to the Prophet]: (The Messiah Jesus son of Mary is about to descend as a just judge and a fair leader...

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: so he will kill the swine, break the cross, and the call (to prayer/religion) will be one). It was narrated by Ahmad (2/394). I say: Its chain is Hasan (good). In an eighth narration from him, attributed to the Prophet (Marfu'), similar to it but without the last sentence, and adding: (And peace will return, and swords will be taken as sickles, and the venom of every venomous creature will go away, and the sky will send down its provision, and the earth will bring forth its blessing, until a child plays with a snake and it does not harm him, and the wolf grazes with the sheep and does not harm them, and the lion grazes with the cow and does not harm it). It was narrated by Ahmad (2/482-483) via Fulaih, from Al-Harith bin Fudayl Al-Ansari, from Ziyad bin Sa'd, from him. I say: Its chain, according to what Ibn Kathir said (1/169): (Good, strong, righteous). However, I have reservations about it from two aspects: First: That Ziyad bin Sa'd - who is the Madinan Ansari - was mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim (1/2/532) from the narration of his son Sa'd bin Ziyad also from him, and he did not mention any disparagement or endorsement regarding him, though Ibn Hibban included him in (Al-Thiqat) (1/73). The other: That this Fulaih - who is Ibn Sulaiman Al-Khuza'i - although he is one of the narrators of the Two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim), acts erroneously often, as Al-Hafiz said in (Al-Taqrib). I say: It is more appropriate to say: It is strong due to what preceded it.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: In a ninth narration from him, attributed to the Prophet (Marfu'), with the wording: (The Hour will not be established until the Romans land at Al-A'maq or Dabiq. An army consisting of the best of the people of the earth at that time will come out from Medina against them. When they arrange themselves in ranks, the Romans will say: 'Leave us and those who were taken as captives from amongst us so we may fight them.' The Muslims will say: 'No, by Allah, we will never abandon our brothers to you.' So they will fight them. Then one-third of them will be defeated, whom Allah will never forgive. One-third will be killed—they are the best of martyrs in the sight of Allah. And one-third will conquer, and they will never be afflicted by tribulation. They will conquer Constantinople (and in a narration: they will reach Constantinople and take spoils). And (in another route from him: Have you heard of a city, one side of which is on land and the other in the sea?) They said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: (The Hour will not be established until seventy thousand of the Children of Isaac invade it. When they come to it, they will dismount and will not fight with weapons nor throw arrows. They will say: 'La ilaha illa Allah wa Allahu Akbar' (There is no god but Allah and Allah is the Greatest), and one of its sides that is in the sea will fall. Then they will say a second time: 'La ilaha illa Allah wa Allahu Akbar', and its other side will fall. Then they will say a third time: 'La ilaha illa Allah wa Allahu Akbar', and it will be opened for them, and they will enter it and take spoils.) While they are dividing the spoils, having hung their swords on the olive trees, Satan will shout among them: 'The Messiah [Ad-Dajjal] has taken your place among your families.' So they will leave, but that is false [so they leave everything and return]. When they come to Sham (Syria), he will emerge. While they are preparing for battle and straightening the ranks, the prayer [the Morning Prayer] is established, and Jesus the son of Mary, peace be upon him, will descend and lead them. When the enemy of Allah sees him, he will dissolve just as

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: salt dissolves in water. If he were to leave him alone, he would dissolve until he perished, but Allah will kill him with his hand, showing them his blood on his spear). Narrated by Muslim (8/175-176), and the context is his; similarly, the other path is his (8/187-188), and the additions are from it. Also narrated by Al-Dani (113/1-2 and 121/2) from both paths, and Al-Hakim (4/482), with the other narration and addition belonging to him, saying: (Authentic according to the conditions of Muslim, though they did not extract it). He erred in his supplementation to Muslim. I say: There is corroborating evidence for part of it from the hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, narrated by Yusayr bin Jabir, who said: A red wind raged in Kufa, and a man came who had nothing to say but: 'O Abdullah bin Mas'ud, the Hour has come.' He [Ibn Mas'ud] sat up - he was reclining - and said: 'The Hour will not be established until inheritance is not divided and spoils are not rejoiced over.' Then he gestured with his hand like this and moved it towards Sham (Syria) and said: 'An enemy gathering against the people of Islam, and the people of Islam gathering against them.' I said: 'Do you mean the Romans?' He said: 'Yes. And at that fighting, there will be a severe apostasy. The Muslims will organize a vanguard pledged to death, not to return unless victorious. They will fight until the night intervenes between them, and both sides will return without victory, and the vanguard will be wiped out. Then the Muslims will organize a vanguard pledged to death, not to return unless victorious. They will fight until the night intervenes between them, and both sides will return without victory, and the vanguard will be wiped out. Then

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: the Muslims will organize a vanguard pledged to death, not to return unless victorious. They will fight until evening, and both sides will return without victory, and the vanguard will be wiped out. Then on the fourth day, the rest of the people of Islam will advance against them, and Allah will decree defeat upon them [the enemy]. They will kill greatly - he either said: the likes of which has not been seen, or said: has not been seen - such that a bird will pass by their flanks and will not pass them before falling dead. The sons of a father who were one hundred will be counted, and none will be found remaining of them except one man. So with what spoils can one rejoice? Or what inheritance can be divided? While they are in that state, they will hear of an affliction greater than that. A crier will come to them saying that the Dajjal has taken their place among their offspring. So they will discard what is in their hands and advance, sending ten horsemen as a scout party. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: (I surely know their names, the names of their fathers, and the colors of their horses. They are the best horsemen on the face of the earth on that day).' Narrated by Ahmad (1/435) and Muslim (8/177-178). In a tenth narration from him, attributed to the Prophet: (Jesus the son of Mary will descend, break the cross, kill the swine, abolish the Jizyah, and Allah, Mighty and Majestic, will destroy the Dajjal in his time, and the Word will be established for Allah, Lord of the Worlds). Narrated by Al-Dani (143/2) and Ibn Mandah (41/2), and its chain is good (Jayyid). These are ten paths for the hadith of Abu Hurairah alone, so it is Mutawatir (mass transmitted) from him in general, though not in detail.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: The Ninth Hadith: From Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman, like the hadith of Abu Hurairah which I cited just now, but more complete. It mentions the mountain pass of Afiq. It states: (When they stand to pray, Jesus the son of Mary, blessings of Allah be upon him, will descend as their Imam and pray with them (1). When he finishes, he will say like this: 'Clear the way between me and the enemy of Allah.' (Abu Hazim said: Abu Hurairah said: He will dissolve as fat dissolves in the sun. Abdullah bin Amr said: As salt dissolves in water). And Allah will grant the Muslims power over them, so they will break the cross, kill the swine, and abolish the Jizyah). Narrated by Ibn Mandah (95/2) and Al-Hakim (4/490-491) who said: (Authentic according to the conditions of Muslim), and Al-Dhahabi agreed. I say: It contains Khalaf bin Khalifa Al-Ashja'i, who, although a truthful narrator of Muslim, became confused in his later age, so his hadith is good for corroboration. As for Al-Hafiz's statement in (6/478) after attributing it to Ibn Mandah: (Authentic chain), it is an oversight or leniency. The Tenth: From Hudhayfah bin Asid who said: (...But the Dajjal will emerge amidst people's hatred, religious lightness, and bad relations. He will visit every watering place, and the earth will be folded for him like the folding of a ram's skin until he comes to Medina. He will overcome its outskirts but will be prevented from its interior. Then [he will go to] the Mount of Ilyaa [Jerusalem] and besiege a group (1) Meaning: In Jerusalem. As for in Damascus, he prays following the Mahdi, as indicated by other preceding hadiths.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: of Muslims. Those in charge will say to them: 'What are you waiting for regarding this tyrant? Fight him until you meet Allah or He grants you victory.' So they resolve to fight him when morning comes. When they wake up, Jesus the son of Mary is with them. He kills the Dajjal and defeats his companions, such that the trees, stones, and clods of earth will say: 'O believer, this is a Jew with me, so kill him.') Narrated by Al-Hakim (4/529-530) and Abdul Razzaq (20827) in summary. Al-Hakim said: (Authentic chain), and Al-Dhahabi agreed, and it is as they said. The Eleventh: From some of the Companions of Muhammad, peace be upon him, and his hadith has passed (91-92). 32 - This is corroborated by the hadith of Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman mentioned shortly before, which contains: (When he finished (meaning: Jesus from the prayer), he said like this: Clear the way between me and the enemy of Allah). 33 - This is corroborated by several hadiths: First: From Anas who said: (The Dajjal will be followed by seventy thousand Jews of Isfahan wearing Persian shawls [Tayalisah]). Narrated by Muslim (8/207), Ibn Hibban (6760), and Ahmad (3/224). See: (Al-Sahihah) (3080).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Second: From Jabir, and it has passed (p. 89-90) with the wording: (With him will be seventy thousand Jews, each man among them having a sash and an adorned sword). Third: From Uthman bin Abi Al-Aas, similar to it but without mentioning the sword, and it has passed (p. 94-95). Fourth: From Abu Sa'id, attributed to the Prophet (Marfu'), similar to it also without the sword. Narrated by Abdul Razzaq (20825) via Abu Harun from him, but Abu Harun is abandoned (Matruk). Fifth: From Abu Hurairah, attributed to the Prophet (Marfu') with the wording: (The Dajjal will surely descend upon (Khuz) and (Kerman) with seventy thousand whose faces are like hammered shields). Narrated by Ahmad (2/337), and its narrators are trustworthy except for the 'an'ana [ambiguous mode of transmission] of Ibn Ishaq. 34 - This paragraph's corroborations have preceded from the narration of a group of Companions: First: Jabir (p. 71-73). Second: Some Companions of Muhammad, peace be upon him (p. 91-92). Third: Uthman bin Abi Al-Aas (p. 94-95). Fourth: Abu Hurairah (p. 102-103).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Fifth: Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman (p. 105). 35 - I did not find a corroborating evidence for it. 36 - Concerning it, there are hadiths: First: From Mujammi' bin Jariyah Al-Ansari who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: (The son of Mary will kill the Dajjal at the Gate of Ludd). Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (2245), Ibn Hibban (1901), Al-Tayalisi (2/219), Abdul Razzaq (20835), Ahmad (3/420), and Al-Dani (143/1 & 2). Al-Tirmidhi said: (Hasan Sahih hadith). I say: Perhaps he means due to its following corroborations, otherwise, the chain includes Ubaydullah bin Abdullah bin Tha'labah Al-Ansari, who is unknown (Majhul), and there is disagreement regarding his name. Second: From An-Nawas bin Sam'an, attributed to the Prophet (Marfu'), similar to it, and his hadith has passed (p. 56-58). Third: From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, attributed to the Prophet (Marfu'), similar to it, and her hadith has passed (p. 59-60). And Abdul Razzaq narrated (20836) with an authentic chain: That Umar asked a man from the Jews about something? He spoke to him, and Umar believed him. Then Umar said to him: I have tested your truthfulness, so tell me about the Dajjal. He said: By the God of the Jews, the son of Mary will kill him at the courtyard of (Ludd).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 37 - Concerning it, there are hadiths: First: From Uthman bin Abi Al-Aas, which is at the end of his previously mentioned hadith (p. 94-95). Second: From Jabir, which is also at the end of his previously mentioned hadith (71-73). Third: From Hudhayfah bin Asid, and it passed also (105-106). Fourth: From Ibn Umar, and it passed (p. 88), but he has another path more authentic than that one with the wording: (The Jews will fight you, and you will be given dominion over them, until the stone says: O Muslim, this is a Jew behind me, so kill him). Narrated by Abdul Razzaq (20837), and from him Ahmad (2/149), and Al-Tirmidhi (2237) who said: (Hasan Sahih hadith). Then Ahmad (2/122 & 131), Al-Bukhari (6/78 & 478), and Muslim (8/188) narrated it via paths other than Abdul Razzaq. Also narrated by Al-Dani (65/1). Fifth: From Abu Hurairah: That the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: (The Hour will not be established until the Muslims fight the Jews, and the Muslims will kill them until the Jew hides behind the stone and the tree, and the stone or the tree says: O Muslim,

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: O servant of Allah, this is a Jew behind me, so come and kill him. Except for the Gharqad, for it is from the trees of the Jews). Narrated by the Two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim), Ahmad (2/398, 417, 530), Al-Khatib (7/207), and Al-Dani (64/2 - 65/1). 38 - All hadiths agree that the days of Dajjal during which he travels the earth are forty, but they differed regarding these days: are they forty years as in this narration, or forty days and nights as in other narrations? The correct view that must be asserted is the second, because they are more authentic and numerous as will be clarified. As for this narration, along with the weakness of its chain as clarified at the beginning of this research - I have not found for it a valid corroborating evidence that can be relied upon, except perhaps the hadith of Shahr bin Hawshab previously mentioned (p. 77) from Asma bint Yazid in his narration from her with the wording: (The Dajjal will stay on earth forty years; the year like a month, the month like a week, the week like a day, and the day like the burning of a palm branch in fire). However, it is a rejected (Munkar) hadith due to the weakness of Shahr and his being solitary in narrating it, so it does not serve as a witness. Nor is it strengthened by what Suhail bin Abi Salih narrated from his father from Abu Hurairah, attributed to the Prophet: (The Hour will not be established until time contracts, so the year will be like a month, the month like a week, the week like a day, the day like an hour, and the hour like the burning of a palm branch or leaf).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Narrated by Ahmad (2/537-538), Abu Ya'la (302/1), and Ibn Hibban (1888). I say: Its chain is authentic according to the conditions of Muslim, and so said Ibn Kathir (1/213). It has a witness from the hadith of Anas bin Malik attributed to the Prophet (Marfu') with it. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (2333) who considered it Ghareeb (strange). And another from the Mursal of Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib narrated by Al-Dani (14/1). I say: This does not strengthen the hadith of Shahr because it does not mention the Dajjal in it, as is apparent; it is general. And it is not permissible to restrict it - meaning: the hadith of Shahr due to its weakness - especially since the result after restriction conflicts with other narrations, and this is impermissible as is obvious to those of understanding. As for the narrations referred to, which explicitly state that the forty of Dajjal are days and not years, they are from the narration of a group of Companions, and they have all passed, so I suffice with pointing to their narrations: First: An-Nawas bin Sam'an, passed (p. 56-58). Second: Nufayr father of Jubayr, passed (p. 59). Third: A man from the Companions of the Prophet, peace be upon him, passed (p. 71). Fourth: Jabir bin Abdullah, passed (p. 71-73 & 87). Fifth: Abu Hurairah, passed (p. 54). I say: These authentic hadiths are not contradicted by the hadith of Abdullah bin Amr who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said:

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: (The Dajjal will emerge in my Ummah and stay among them for forty days, or forty nights, or forty months. Then Allah, Mighty and Majestic, will send Jesus the son of Mary - as if he is Urwah bin Mas'ud Al-Thaqafi - so he will seek him and destroy him. Then people will remain after him for seven years with no enmity between any two. Then Allah will send a cold wind from the direction of Sham, so no one having an atom's weight of faith in his heart will remain on the face of the earth but that it will take him...) Narrated by Ahmad (2/166) and Muslim (8/201). Al-Hakim added it as a supplement (to the Two Sahihs) (4/543-544 & 550-551) but erred, and Ibn Hibban (7309) and Ibn Mandah (98/2). I say: This does not contradict the previous hadiths because of the uncertainty in it, and it appears it is from one of its narrators. The one who is uncertain has no knowledge, while those [others] were certain about the forty days, and the one who knows is a proof over the one who does not.
