It is possible that the uncertainty was from the Prophet, peace be upon him, himself, occurring before the revelation came to him regarding the duration of those days, then it came to him. This is supported by the hadith of Abu Hurairah: (In forty days, Allah knows best their duration). Ibn Hibban added: (Allah knows best their duration (twice)). 39 - This context is weak and strange, contradicting the authentic hadiths that were previously indicated, for what is preserved in them is: (Forty days; a day like a year, a day like a month, a day like a week, and the rest of his days like your days).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 40 - This paragraph has no mention in those authentic hadiths. It is only established in the hadith of Abu Hurairah previously mentioned (p. 110) with the wording: (The Hour will not be established until time contracts... and the hour becomes like the burning of a palm branch). It does not mention the Dajjal as previously stated. 41 - I found no corroborating evidence for it at all. 42 - I found no basis for it with this context mentioning short days. What is preserved is what passed in the hadith of An-Nawas and Nufayr father of Jubayr: (We said: O Messenger of Allah, that day which is like a year, will the prayer of one day suffice us in it? He said: No, estimate for it its measure). 43 - This paragraph in its entirety came in the hadith of Abu Hurairah mentioned previously via numerous paths (p. 96-103). 44 - It is corroborated by the hadith of Tawus who narrates it saying: (Jesus the son of Mary will descend as a guided leader and a just ruler. When he descends, he will break the cross, kill the swine, and abolish the Jizyah. The religion will be one, and security will be placed on earth such that the lion will be with the cow thinking it is its bull, and the wolf will be with the sheep thinking it is its dog. The venom of every venomous creature will be removed until a man places his hand on the head of a snake and it does not harm him, and until the young girl chases away the lion just as the puppy of a small dog runs away. The Arabian horse will cost twenty dirhams, and the ox will cost such and such. The earth will return

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: to its state during the time of Adam. The bunch - meaning: of grapes - will be eaten by a group of people, and the pomegranate will be eaten by a group of people). Narrated by Abdul Razzaq (20843). I say: Its chain is Mursal Sahih; its narrators are trustworthy narrators of the Two Sheikhs. 45 - Evidence for this paragraph has preceded in the hadith of Tawus before it and in the paths of the hadith of Abu Hurairah referred to just now. One path remains which contains evidence for what was not previously corroborated - like the first sentence of it and others - so it was necessary to cite it. It is from the narration of Zaid bin Aslam from a man from Abu Hurairah who said: (The Hour will not be established until Jesus the son of Mary descends as a just ruler, and Quraysh are [stripped] (1) of authority, the swine is killed, the cross is broken, the Jizyah is abolished, the prostration becomes one for the Lord of the Worlds, war lays down its burdens, the earth is filled with Islam just as vessels are filled with water, the earth becomes like a silver platter (meaning: table), hatred and enmity are removed, the wolf is among the sheep as if it were their dog, and the lion is among the camels as if it were their stallion). Narrated by Abdul Razzaq (20844) via Ma'mar from him.

text: I say: Its chain consists entirely of trustworthy narrators except the man who was not named, who is among the senior Successors (Tabi'in) if not a Companion, for Zaid is a Successor who narrated from a group of Companions including Abu Hurairah himself, Ibn Umar, and others. Even if it is Mawquf (stopped at the Companion), it has the ruling of Marfu' (raised to the Prophet) because it concerns unseen matters that cannot be said by mere opinion, especially since most of it has come as Marfu' as previously mentioned. The sentence about the pomegranate from this paragraph has a witness in the hadith of An-Nawas previously extracted (p. 56-58), although it was not cited in its entirety containing the witness. 46 & 47 - I found no corroborating evidence for them at all. 48 - It is corroborated by the hadith of Asma bint Yazid Al-Ansariyyah previously mentioned (p. 57-76). 49 - It is corroborated by four hadiths: First: The hadith of Asma referred to just now. Second: The hadith of Aisha previously mentioned (p. 93-94). Third: The hadith of Ibn Umar: That the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was asked about the food of the believers in the time of Dajjal? He said: (The food of the angels). They said: And what is the food of the angels? He said: (Their food is their speech of Tasbih [glorifying Allah] and Taqdis [sanctifying Allah]. Whoever's speech on that day is Tasbih and Taqdis, Allah will remove hunger from him so he will not fear hunger).

text: Narrated by Al-Hakim (4/511) who said: (Authentic chain according to the conditions of Muslim). Al-Dhahabi rejected it saying: (I say: Nay, for Sa'id is accused [of fabrication] and ruined). I say: Meaning Sa'id bin Sinan Al-Homsi. Fourth: From Asma bint Umais: That the Prophet, peace be upon him, entered upon her for some need then left. She complained to him about need, so he said: (How will you be when you are tested with a servant for whom the rivers of the earth and its fruits are subjugated? Whoever follows him, he feeds him and makes him a disbeliever, and whoever disobeys him, he deprives him and forbids him?). I said: O Messenger of Allah, the servant girl sits at the oven for an hour to bake her bread and I almost get tempted in my prayer [by hunger/impatience], so how will it be for us when that happens? He said: (Indeed Allah will protect the believers on that day with what He protected the angels: Tasbih. Between his eyes is 'Kafir' which every believer, literate or illiterate, will read). Al-Haythami said (7/346): (Narrated by Al-Tabarani, and it contains a narrator who was not named, but the rest of its narrators are narrators of the Sahih). In summary, the hadith of Abu Umamah, even if its chain has weakness, it has become clear from this extraction and verification - the likes of which is rare - that it is an authentic hadith in most of its paragraphs due to the corroborating evidences mentioned for each paragraph.

text: The Story of the Antichrist (Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal) and the Descent of Jesus, Peace and Blessings Be Upon Him, and his Killing of him, according to the context of the narration of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, added to it what is authentic from others among the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 1 - O People! There has never been a tribulation (fitnah) on the face of the earth since Allah created the progeny of Adam - [nor will there be until the Hour is established] - greater than the tribulation of the Dajjal. [And no one will be saved from what is before it unless he is saved from it] [And he does not harm a Muslim]. 2 - And indeed, Allah has not sent a prophet except that he warned his nation of the [One-eyed] Dajjal. [I surely warn you of him]. 3 - And I am the last of the Prophets, and you are the last of the nations. 4 - And he is emerging among you inevitably. [It is true, and as for it being near, everything that is coming is near]. [He only emerges due to an anger that he becomes angry] and [he does not emerge until inheritance is not divided and spoils are not rejoiced over].

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 5 - If he emerges while I am among you, then I am the advocate for every Muslim; and if he emerges after me, then every person is his own advocate, and Allah is my successor over every Muslim. (And in the hadith of Umm Salama: If he emerges after I die, Allah will suffice you against him through the righteous). 6 - And he emerges [from [a land] in the East] [called: (Khurasan)] [among the Jews of Isfahan] [their faces appearing like hammered shields] from a road between Sham (Syria) and Iraq. He spreads corruption to the right [and spreads corruption] to the left. O servants of Allah, stand firm. [Three times].

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 7 - I will describe him to you with a description that no prophet before me has described him with. (And in the hadith of Ubadah: I have told you about the Dajjal until I feared you would not understand). 8 - He starts by saying: 'I am a prophet,' but there is no prophet after me. 9 - Then he praises again and says: 'I am your Lord.' But you will not see your Lord until you die. 10 - And he is one-eyed [wiped] [left eye] [having a thick film on it] [green like a floating star] [his right eye looks like a floating grape] [not protruding nor sunken] [with thick hair] [Beware,

text: whatever is hidden from you regarding his state, let it not be hidden from you] that your Lord is not one-eyed [Beware, whatever is hidden from you regarding his state, let it not be hidden from you that your Lord is not one-eyed] [Three times] [and he pointed with his hand to his eyes] [and that you will never see your Lord until you die]. 11 - [He walks on earth, while the earth and sky belong to Allah]. 12 - [He is a young man with curly hair, I liken him to Abdul Uzza bin Qatan] [short, pigeon-toed, intense black eyes] [white complexion]. 13 - [And he is dark, curly-haired] [with thick hair].

An army comes out to them from Medina consisting of

text: of the best people of the earth at that time. When they arrange their ranks, the Romans say: 'Leave us and those who were taken captive from us so we may fight them.' The Muslims say: 'No. By Allah, we will not abandon our brothers to you.' So they fight them. [And at that fighting there will be severe apostasy. The Muslims will organize a vanguard pledged to death, not to return unless victorious. They will fight until night intervenes between them, and both sides return without victory, and the vanguard is wiped out. Then the Muslims will organize a vanguard pledged to death, not to return unless victorious. They will fight until night intervenes between them, and both sides return without victory, and the vanguard is wiped out. Then the Muslims will organize a vanguard pledged to death, not to return unless victorious. They will fight until evening, and both sides return without victory, and the vanguard is wiped out. Then on the fourth day, the rest of the people of Islam will advance against them]. Then one-third will be defeated, whom Allah will never forgive. One-third will be killed - [they are] the best of martyrs in the sight of Allah. And one-third will conquer, and they will never be afflicted by tribulation. [Allah will decree defeat upon them (the Romans), and they will be killed in a slaughter - either he said: the likes of which has not been seen, or said: has not been seen - such that a bird will pass by their flanks and will not pass them before falling dead. The sons of a father who were one hundred will be counted, and none will be found remaining of them except one man. So with what spoils can one rejoice, or what inheritance can be divided?]. They will reach Constantinople and conquer it. (And in a narration: Have you heard of a city, one side of which is on land and the other in the sea? They said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: The Hour will not be established until seventy thousand of the Children of Isaac invade it. When they come to it, they will dismount and will not fight with weapons nor throw arrows. They will say: 'La ilaha illa Allah wa Allahu Akbar', and one of its sides that is in the sea will fall. Then they will say a second time: 'La ilaha illa Allah wa Allahu Akbar', and its other side will fall.

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: Then they will say a third time: 'La ilaha illa Allah wa Allahu Akbar', and it will be opened for them, and they will enter it and take spoils). While they are dividing the spoils - having hung their swords on the olive trees - Satan shouts among them: 'The Messiah [Ad-Dajjal] has taken your place among your families.' [So they discard what is in their hands] and leave, but that is false. [They send ten horsemen as a scout party. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: (I surely know their names, the names of their fathers, and the colors of their horses. They are the best horsemen on the face of the earth on that day)]. When they come to Sham (Syria), he emerges]. 24 - And there remains nothing of the earth but he treads upon it and prevails over it except [four mosques: the Mosque of] Mecca, the [Mosque of] Medina, [Al-Tur (Sinai), and Al-Aqsa Mosque]. 25 - And his days are forty days; a day like a year, a day like a month, a day like a week, and the rest of his days like your days. They said: That day which is like a year, will the prayer of one day suffice us in it? He said: No, estimate for it its measure. They said: How is his speed in the earth? He said: Like the rain driven by the wind].

text: 26 - Before the emergence of the Dajjal, there are three severe years in which people suffer severe hunger. Allah commands the sky in the first year to withhold one-third of its rain, and commands the earth to withhold one-third of its vegetation. Then He commands the sky in the second year to withhold two-thirds of its rain, and commands the earth to withhold two-thirds of its vegetation. Then He commands the sky in the third year to withhold all its rain, so not a drop falls, and commands the earth to withhold all its vegetation, so no green thing grows. No hoofed animal remains except that it perishes, except what Allah wills. It was said: What will people live on in that time? He said: Tahlil (saying La ilaha illa Allah), Takbir (saying Allahu Akbar), Tasbih (saying Subhan Allah), and Tahmid (saying Alhamdulillah). That will take the place of food for them. 27 - He does not come to Mecca and Medina from any of their passes except that angels meet him with unsheathed swords. 28 - [There is no town that the terror of the Messiah [Ad-Dajjal] does not reach except Medina. [It has on that day seven gates] on every pass of its passes are two angels defending it from the terror of the Messiah]. 29 - Until he camps at the marsh [the marsh of Al-Jurf] [behind Uhud] [and sets up his tent].

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: 30 - Then Medina will shake with its inhabitants three times, and no hypocrite man or woman will remain except they go out to him. It expels the impurity from it just as the bellows expels the impurity of iron. That day is called the Day of Deliverance. [And the majority of those who go out to him are women]. 31 - [Then a man from the believers heads towards him [filled with youth] [he is the best of people on that day or among the best]. The armed guards - the guards of Dajjal - meet him and say to him: 'Where are you heading?' He says: 'I am heading to this one who has emerged.' He said: They say to him: 'Do you not believe in our lord?' He says: 'There is nothing hidden about our Lord.' They say: 'Kill him.' Then they say to one another: 'Did your lord not forbid you to kill anyone without him?' So they take him to the Dajjal. When the believer sees him, he says: 'O people, [I bear witness that] this is the Dajjal whom the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, mentioned (and in a path: narrated to us) [his hadith].' He said: The Dajjal orders him to be laid out, saying: 'Take him and lay him out.' So his back and stomach are beaten severely. He said: Then he says: 'Do you not believe in me?' He said: He says: 'You are

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: the lying Messiah.' [Then the Dajjal says: 'Do you see if I kill this one then revive him, will you doubt the matter?' They say: 'No']. He said: So he orders for him, and he is sawed with a saw from the parting of his hair until his legs are separated [so he kills him]. (And in the hadith of An-Nawas: He strikes him with a sword and cuts him into two pieces, placed as far apart as a target). He said: Then the Dajjal walks between the two pieces and says to him: 'Stand up.' So he stands up straight. He said: [Then he calls him, and he comes with a beaming face, laughing]. Then he says to him: 'Do you believe in me?' He says: '[By Allah] I have only increased in insight concerning you.' He said: Then he says: 'O people, he will not do this to anyone after me among mankind.' He said: The Dajjal takes him to slaughter him, but the area between his neck and collarbone is made into copper, so he finds no way to him. He said: So he takes him by his hands and feet and casts him. People think he cast him into the Fire, but he was cast into Paradise. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: This is the greatest of people in martyrdom with the Lord of the Worlds]. 32 - [Then the angels turn his face towards Sham] [Then the Dajjal comes to the Mount of Ilyaa (Jerusalem)

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: and besieges a group of Muslims] [The believers face severe hardship] [And people flee from the Dajjal into the mountains]. Umm Sharik bint Abi Al-Akar said: 'O Messenger of Allah, where are the Arabs on that day?' He said: 'They are few on that day.' 33 - Their Imam is a righteous man. [And he, peace be upon him, said: The Mahdi is from us, the Ahl al-Bayt [from the descendants of Fatimah]. Allah rectifies him in a night] [His name matches my name and his father's name matches my father's name] [He has a broad forehead and a prominent nose] [He fills the earth with equity and justice

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: as it was filled with oppression and tyranny] [He rules for seven years] - And he, peace be upon him, said: (Two groups of my Ummah Allah has protected from the Fire: a group that invades India and a group that will be with Jesus the son of Mary, peace be upon him - And he said: Whoever among you meets him, let him convey my greetings to him). 34 - [While their Imam has stepped forward to lead them in the Morning Prayer, Jesus the son of Mary descends upon them [from the sky] at dawn] [at the white minaret east of Damascus, between two yellow garments, placing his palms on the wings of two angels. When he lowers his head, it drips, and when he raises it, beads like pearls scatter from it. It is not lawful for a disbeliever to smell the scent of his breath except that he dies, and his breath reaches as far as his sight ends]. 35 - [There is no prophet between me and him (meaning: Jesus), and he is descending. So when you see him, recognize him: a man of medium height, reddish-white, between two yellowish garments, as if his head is dripping though no moisture touched it. He will fight the people for Islam, break the cross, kill the swine, abolish the Jizyah, and Allah will destroy all religions in his time except Islam).

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: - And he said: (How will you be when the son of Mary descends among you and your Imam (and in a narration: and he leads you) is from among you?). Ibn Abi Dhi'b said: Do you know what 'he leads you from among you' means? I said: Tell me. He said: He leads you by the Book of your Lord, Blessed and Exalted, and the Sunnah of your Prophet, peace be upon him]. 36 - That Imam retreats - walking backwards - so that Jesus may come forward [and says: Come, lead us in prayer]. Jesus places his hand between his shoulders and says to him: [No, some of you are leaders over others, an honor from Allah to this Ummah]. Go forward and pray. So their Imam leads them in prayer. 37 - [Then the Dajjal comes to the mountain of (Ilyaa) and besieges a group of Muslims] [Those in charge say to them: What are you waiting for regarding this tyrant [except] to fight him until you meet Allah or He grants you victory? So they resolve to fight him when morning comes]. 38 - [While they are preparing for battle and straightening the ranks, the prayer is established]

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: [the Morning Prayer] [They wake up and Jesus the son of Mary is with them] [He leads the people, and when he raises his head from his bowing, he says: Allah hears he who praises Him; Allah has killed the Messiah Dajjal and the Muslims have prevailed]. When he finishes, he says: Open the door. It is opened, and behind it is the Dajjal with seventy thousand Jews, all of them with adorned swords and sashes. [Jesus, peace be upon him, pursues him] 39 - [Jesus goes with his spear towards the Dajjal]. When the Dajjal sees him, he dissolves just as salt dissolves in water. [If he were to leave him alone, he would dissolve until he perished, but Allah kills him with his hand, showing them his blood on his spear]. He catches him at the Eastern Gate of Ludd and kills him. [Allah, Mighty and Majestic, destroys him at the mountain pass of Afiq]. 40 - Allah defeats the Jews [and gives the Muslims power over them] [and they kill them].

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: So nothing of what Allah created remains for a Jew to hide behind except that Allah makes that thing speak - neither stone, nor tree, nor wall, nor animal - except the Gharqad tree, for it is from their trees and does not speak - except it says: O servant of Allah, O Muslim, this is a Jew [behind me], so come and kill him. 41 - [Then people remain after him for seven years with no enmity between any two]. 42 - Jesus the son of Mary, peace be upon him, will be in my Ummah [confirming Muhammad, peace be upon him, on his religion] a just judge and a fair Imam [guided]. [He fights people for Islam, so] he breaks the cross, kills the swine, [and prayer is gathered for him],

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: and abolishes the Jizyah and leaves charity (Sadaqah) [because of abundance of wealth], so no one strives [to collect Zakat] on sheep or camel. Hatred and mutual animosity are lifted [and envy, and money will be offered but no one will accept it] [until one prostration is better than the world and what is in it] [and the call becomes one for the Lord of the Worlds]. - [By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, the son of Mary will surely enter Ihram at the valley of (Al-Rawha') as a Hajj pilgrim or performing Umrah, or combining both]. 43 - Then a people whom Allah has protected from him (Dajjal) come to Jesus the son of Mary, so he wipes their faces and tells them of their ranks in Paradise. While he is like that, Allah reveals to Jesus: 'I have brought forth servants of Mine whom no one has the power to fight, so take My servants to safety to Al-Tur (Mount Sinai).' And Allah sends Gog and Magog, and they swarm down from every height. Their first ones pass by Lake Tiberias and drink what is in it, and their last ones pass and say: 'There was once water here.' [Then they travel until they reach the Mountain of Al-Khamar - which is the Mountain of Al-Khamar - which is the mountain of Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) - and they say: 'We have killed those on earth, come let us kill those in the heaven.' So they throw

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: their arrows towards the sky, and Allah returns their arrows to them dyed with blood]. The Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions are besieged until the head of a bull for one of them is better than a hundred dinars for one of you today. The Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions beseech Allah, so Allah sends upon them (Gog and Magog) worms (Naghaf) in their necks, and they die as the death of a single soul. Then the Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions descend to the earth, and they do not find in the earth the space of a span except that their fat and stench has filled it. So the Prophet of Allah Jesus and his companions beseech Allah, and He sends birds like the necks of Bactrian camels, which carry them and throw them where Allah wills. Then Allah sends rain which no house of clay or hair (tent) can keep out, and it washes the earth until it leaves it like a mirror (or smooth rock). Then it is said to the earth: 'Bring forth your fruit and return your blessing.' On that day, a group will eat from a single pomegranate and seek shade under its skin. Milk will be blessed such that a milch camel will suffice a large group of people, a milch cow will suffice a tribe of people, and a milch sheep will suffice a clan of people]. And the bull will be for such and such amount of money, and the horse for a few dirhams. - [And he, peace be upon him, said: (Blessed is the life after the Messiah, blessed is the life after the Messiah. Permission is given

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: to the sky for rain and permission is given to the earth for plants. Even if you were to sow your seed on a smooth stone, it would grow. There will be no stinginess, no envy, and no hatred)]. 44 - And the venom of every venomous creature is removed [and security falls upon the earth until lions graze with camels, tigers with cows, and wolves with sheep, and children play with snakes without them harming them] until a child puts his hand in a snake's mouth and it does not harm him. A young girl chases a lion and it does not harm her. The wolf is among the sheep as if it were their dog. The earth is filled with peace as a vessel is filled with water. The word becomes one, and none is worshipped but Allah. War lays down its burdens, and Quraysh is stripped of its kingdom. [Then it is said: The earth will be like a silver platter, growing its vegetation as in the time of Adam]. 45 - [Jesus, peace be upon him, remains on earth for forty years, then he passes away and the Muslims pray over him]. 46 - While they are like that, Allah sends a wind [cold from the direction of Sham] that takes them under their armpits and seizes the soul of every believer and every Muslim. (And in the hadith of Ibn Amr: No one remains on the face of the earth having an atom's weight of faith in his heart except

book_title: The Story of the Antichrist and the Descent of Jesus, Peace Be Upon Him
text: that it seizes him, even if one of them were inside a mountain, it would enter upon him). The worst of people remain [in the lightness of birds and the dreams/minds of predatory beasts; they do not recognize good nor deny evil. He said: Satan impersonates himself to them and says: 'Will you not respond?' So he commands them to worship idols, and they do so. While in that state, their provision is abundant and their life is good]. They will mate publicly like donkeys; upon them the Hour will be established]. 47 - [The Trumpet is blown, and no one hears it except he tilts his neck and raises it. The first to hear it is a man repairing the trough of his camels. He will be struck unconscious, and the people will be struck unconscious. Then Allah sends - or he said: Allah sends down - rain like dew or shadow - doubt from the narrator - from which the bodies of people grow. Then it is blown a second time, and behold, they are standing, looking on [Az-Zumar: 68]. Then it is said: 'O people, come to your Lord.' And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned [As-Saffat: 24]. Then it is said: 'Bring out the delegation of the Fire.' It is said: 'From how many?' It is said: 'From every thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine.' That is the Day that will make the children white-haired [Al-Muzzammil: 17], and that is the Day the shin will be uncovered [Al-Qalam: 42]]. [This is the last of what his eminence Sheikh Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani wrote of this valuable book. May Allah have mercy on him with vast mercy and grant him abundant reward]. Publisher.
